It has several different plot lines that all weave together in to one story.  It was very funny, I laughed until my stomach hurt, and it had THE BEST ending I have seen in a movie in a long time.  The acting was superb, Brad Pitt was hilarious, along with all the other actors I had never seen before.  You have GOT to see this movie!!!

This movie was the best comedy of all times! I specially liked the jokes about the Russians, because most of them were the reality. And Brad Pitt as the gypsy boxer was just great, i just wonder how long did it take to learn talking like that. Anyway, as i already said, this movie is really good! Guy Ritchie is a genius!

Review title: THE man's movie of the year...violent and outrageously funny
Review_body: This is the man's movie of the year...it has two of the three primary things men love in a movie: plenty of extreme violence (the worst things are slightly below the bottom of the frame), and simultaneous hysterically funny visual humor.  The collection of characters are all fascinating; the plot is complex, but the breathtaking pace of the journey through its twists and turns is (with a single very moving exception) delightful; the score is perfectly chosen to support each scene, and the acting is an ensemble tour de force, not the least of which is Brad Pitt's dedicated performance.

Similar to Lock Stock and 2 Smoking Barrels but if it ain't broke... Guy Ritchie uses the cast of lesser known British actors to good effect and contrary to expectations, Brad Pitt adds a lot to the film. The only criticism would be that some of the music, e.g. Golden Brown & Dreadlock Holiday, seems to be squeezed into the movie presumably for the benefit of the ubiquitous soundtrack album.

Just Awful!!!!!  I have nothing else to say about this movie except that it is plain awful.  You can't understand a word any of them are saying, especially Brad Pitt.  I'm sure most women won't mind anyway since the man is half naked throughout the whole thing.  I happen to be a man though so when I see a movie with half naked men I want it to either make sense or at least be understandable.  Anyway my final rating is two thumbs way down. If you like it, I'm happy for you.  As for me, I'd rather watch Spice World again.

The first night I went to watch this movie (opening night) I was completely blown away.  The sound and cinematography worked perfectly.  The script was good, the characters excellent and the actors were actually good actors.This was not just a movie, it was an experience unlike any other.That was on the first night.  Three shows later I still think this movie is amazing and I'm starting to see more and more little hidden tidbits.I suggest you get to this movie ASAP.

Review title: Horrible plot that uses extreme violence to make it interesting
Review_body: The way the story unfolds is completely unbelievable, and not in a good way. Extreme violence is used to compensate for the fact that the plot is completely unrealistic. Either Mr. Richie has no understanding of reality or just didn't care because he knew that the violence would make up for his terrible writing. I would have given it one star but the casting is ok so some of the characters are decent. Its entertaining the first watch, the second watch its just plain stupid.

Review title: Guy Ritchie works his magic again
Review_body: I had no idea what to expect when I went to see this film.  I was happily surprised at what I saw.  Guy Ritchie is another director who knows how to use high quality music video style, snappy editing and directing.  Ritchie has written another wild, snarled plot in the tradition of Pulp Fiction. Actually, this film is extremely similar to Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels - identical would not be a stretch.  But Ritchie is not plagiarizing - L, S, and 2SB is his film also. Like Run, Lola, Run, the music video style is used here only where it helps the film, not impedes it.  The most inventive use takes us across the Atlantic in about 3 seconds - you'll have to see it to know what I mean. Almost all the characters have incredibly thick accents, requiring complete attention on the part of the viewer to catch the dialogue.  But that only adds to the overall quirkiness of the film.  All the actors are fairly good. The one who really shines, though, is Brad Pitt.  He wallows in his seediness in this film, and appears to love doing it.  His impenetrable Irish accent is really impossible to decipher, and creates some very funny moments. The other thing Ritchie plays with is time.  A spectacular scene where three cars and three story lines interact is done in reverse.  This scene is absolutely hilarious and very inspired. Warning note to guys:  This is quite the guy's film.  Think twice about taking a date with you to this one. With that said, I need to go reserve my copy of the video before it comes out.  10/10!!!

This movie I watched, and I was amazed at the cinematography that it had. I think Guy Ritchie did a fabulous job getting across the information that he needed to get into the movie for people to understand it.  He also had a large slu of characters so you could pick and choose who you were rooting for or who you liked the most.  The English accents arnt that bad either

What can I say. It's been ages since I've had the opporotunity to feast my eyes upon such an elaborate masterpiece. With whacky characters, all with unique and hilarious personalities, the film excels in demonstrating how greed can drive humans of all sorts to such extremes as dismembring limbs, feeding people to pigs, and burning down caravans. The brightest point in the film is without a doubt Brad Pitt playing Micky, a bare-knuckle boxing gypsy. His attitude, facial expressions, and strange,almost ununderstandable accent will keep you laughing from the first meeting between him and Turkish, to the startling climax at a boxing match. The rest of the movie which includes a man with a briefcase attatched to his arm, crude gangsters, and a dog will leave you with a complete feeling of satisfaction despite the questionable overabundance of violence. Overall it is a definite 10/10, if you can stomach it.

What's amazing to me is that American filmmakers keep churning out movies with no plot, bad special effects, terrible dialog, horrible acting, cartoonishly fake fight scenes, and the public simply goes crazy for it. Hollywood is to movies what fast food is to fine cuisine.Here is a great British movie that didn't get a lot of hype. It's fresh, different, edgy, and creative. Why Guy Ritchie didn't do more like this I couldn't guess (Lock, stock & 2 smoking barrels is also a must see). Unlike most American movies, the acting is all around phenomenal, but the best performances go to the actors playing Brick Top & Bullet Tooth Tony. The story has so many twists and it'll keep you guessing until the end. The humor in this is very dark, & the film has a certain "grittiness" to it that is perfect for the story & characters.Do yourself a favor, & check this out. You won't be disappointed.

One of the best movies I have ever seen..I don't know what to say first. Very clever dialogues, excellent implicit humor, the characters just lovable and Brad Pitt in one of his best performances..Of course that would be unfair to mention only Pitt because everyone in the movie acted great, but Pitt is in a kind surprising role.Guy Ritchie wrote and directed an amazing film with so many different characters demonstrating a comical view of the underworld, contrary to the commonsense. The beyond compare humor of the movie stays at the most appropriate level and never is too much..It is a movie that can be seen again and again.Guy Ritchie proves after ''lock, stock and two smoking barrels'' that he is here to stay. Well done..!

Review title: Worth the art of it all.
Review_body: This film doesn't hesitate to get right to the action.  The opening credits alone were a draw for me.  The fast frame, freeze action was masterfully done.  Throughout the film, the viewer is given the eyes of several of the characters, by use of the camera, which was quite enjoyable.  The use of different angles really emphasized the emotion and tasteful action of each scene as well as evoked a sense of interaction with the viewer.  The line between what's reality and what isn't becomes really thin when the viewer becomes engaged as such. One thing, though, the accents were hard to follow, so for me, watching the film was a bit of work, but well worth it in lieu of the art of it.

Review title: Great Movie With Great Performances and Great Comedic Sequences!
Review_body: One word to describe this movie = there isn't one! The only words that could possibly even give this movie slight justice would have to be-absolutely awesome and completely amazing motion picture that is a guaranteed favorite for ALL viewers. Vinnie Jones and Jason Statham give Grade A performances, needless to mention the astounding characteristic development that Dennis Farina featured over "Cousin" Avi. When I put this movie on during a boring Sunday afternoon, my knees immediately buckled. I just couldn't watch Snatch. without sitting. It was just that freakin' awesome. A sure recommendation!

A very funny film would get 10/10 if it was not for the poor Irish accent of Brad Pitt (Mickey O'Neil), Vinnie Jones (Bullet Tooth Tony) plays his usual hard man but plays it very well. But for me the Dog takes the Star Roll.

Review title: This was not what I was expecting.
Review_body: I first heard about this movie when I was looking at the films I hadn't seen from the top 250 list and I read about this. I thought that it would be a very simple and boring movie. But when I saw it I was pleasantly surprised. Although the storyline is pretty simple, the way it is done is not as simple as it sounds. Most of the characters become involved with the diamond whether they like it or not.But what makes this film so interesting. Well for starters the script is full of many funny comments. The acting is also absolutely wonderful. Especially Brad Pitt. Also the editing in some scenes like the milk drink scene keeps you guessing about how the scene will end. Then there is also the boxing scenes, especially the final one that is done by using a mixture of slow motions and still shots. And finally, there is the fun and exciting soundtrack that goes with it.If you liked lock stock and two smoking barrels, then you'll love snatch.

I know this is a really bold statement but Snatch is my favorite movie. The mix of Pitt, Stathom and Del Torro with the direction of Guy Ritchie works perfectly. The badassness mixed with the comic relief through the film is beautifully done. I love how all the story lines keep you guessing throughout the film and in one scene come together in a very unexpected way. The feel of the film reminds me of a Tariteno film with more of a MTV feel which works well with the storyline. The sarcastic and dry British humor keeps the laughs going without venturing to far from the dark somber feel of the plot. It shows how greed and make and break you all in the matter of a week. Snatch is the Usual Suspectsmixed with Lock Stock and Two Smokin Barrels on roids!!! What more could a movie lover ask for?

My favorite thing about this film was the characters, it was almost like a comic book because of so many unique characters. the acting is good, some performances better than others. I do feel that the movie wouldn't of done that great at all without Brad Pit, i feel that its his greatest performance, that accent is terrific. The end of the movie was good but kind of unoriginal in my opinion.I think That Guy Ritchie has talent and this film shows it, but sometimes he bombs terribly. He shows his talent with the many different camera angles that happen in rapid succession. I think people will like this film because of Turkish, he is extremely clever and reliable, people want to be his character. Overall the film was enjoyable, i do recommend it.

This is an Excellent Movie by Guy Ritchie. good Story line and Excellent Preference by Bra Pitt Best Ever Acting of Brad Pitt and Jason Stathem doing his role perfect Overall a good movie and Happy to watch again and agin.This is an Excellent Movie by Guy Ritchie. good Story line and Excellent Preference by Bra Pitt Best Ever Acting of Brad Pitt and Jason Stathem doing his role perfect Overall a good movie and Happy to watch again and agin.This is an Excellent Movie by Guy Ritchie. good Story line and Excellent Preference by Bra Pitt Best Ever Acting of Brad Pitt and Jason Stathem doing his role perfect Overall a good movie and Happy to watch again and agin

Review title: American critics they just don't understand a cockney gangster filmwith Balls!
Review_body: The basic idea of Snatch is that a botched diamond heist leads to a wild and tangled adventure involving gangsters, boxers, and a detailed look at the London underground scene.The film has many story lines that seem to weave in and out of each other so seamlessly that it gives the film a unique style. Explaining the story is a real pig but here goes - The story goes something like this - Franky Four Fingers (Benicio del Toro) arrives in London to deliver a consignment of stolen gems to Doug "The Head" (Mike Reid), In the capital, Franky crosses paths with a "sneaky *beep* Russian" Boris "The Blade" (Rade Serbedzija), who is planning to half-inch the prize diamond for himself while Franky is at the bookies. Unfortunately, Boris's accomplices make a pig's ear of the stick-up, and the rock ends up in the stomach of a deranged mutt.Meanwhile in another plot line would-be boxing promoters Turkish (Jason Statham) and Tommy (Stephen Graham) find themselves in a "tight spot" with local kingpin Bricktop (Alan Ford) in a forthcoming illegal boxing match when their fighter is accidentally knocked out by Irish gypsy Mickey O'Neill (Brad Pitt). Unable to cancel the bout, the pair persuades Bricktop to allow them to enter Mickey in place of their injured man. Unfortunately, the "pikey" Irishman refuses to obey orders to "go down in the fourth", embarrassing Bricktop and his associates and losing him a few bob in the process Unafraid to use bloodshed to make his point, Bricktop exacts a terrible revenge on Mickey's family to stress the point that when he says go down in the fourth, he means it.This film is amazingly more of a cockney comedy than a serious ("the getaway" game style) London gangster plot. Vinnie Jones excels in the role of a London hard nut it's what he does best and the accomplices of the Russian are brilliantly funny and lighten the dark and gritty reality of the plot considerably A definite work of extreme style form Guy Ritchie with an urban soundtrack to match the plot, this film is a welcome follow-up to "Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels" which is also worth watching. No offence but this isn't one for heart warming characters or American critics they just don't understand a Great British gangster filmwith Balls!

Snatch. I watched it the first time 2015, the second and third time 2016. I mean when Jason Statham plays an illegal box promoter and Brad Pitt a Yankee, what do you want more? I was so surprised about the story lines which cross each other. The film is just a masterpiece and one of my favorite films of all time! Statham had his debut also in a Guy Ritchie film: Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels. But in Snatch he is much better and plays an important role. Of course Guy Ritchie made films like Sherlock Holmes or Codename U.N.C.L.E. but this flick is just a masterpiece. I don't wanna spoil anyone, watch it on your own. 8 out of 10 stars.

that they see it snatch the Vincent is a gardener who who is at, Brad Pitt who does not early do what that. When a stone snatch is stolen, Pitt is ended on a bar rule. The way it returns is: this. Vinnie Jones is a hard nut slamming heads in doors again!! then. what does that guy have to say when he does it. of that. What a melon, moustache buns, stolen a 9-carat stone what is. then the routes are blocked by a reads vengeance. Sol,Vinnie and Dezz. who don't do i!!? . when he does not Mickey the Irish boxer. the dog Daisy is the one who does it all. when what happens happens to Boris the blade. Overall the film is a great masterpiece from Guy Ritchie and i recommend it to everyone who likes cockney gangster movies.
Just awesome movie, my one of favorite movie i just love this movie , logan my favorite hero

I have to say I thought this would be a total "dude" movie but I was pleasantly surprised.  This movie has great acting, story, and directing. All did a wonderful job putting this movie together.  The effects were even kewl.  Would highly recommend!

Review title: Hilarious gangster comedy with original photography and good story line
Review_body: I can only confirm the comments of the previous commentator, but perhaps add that, if you are a guy, you may not have to fear your girlfriend does not like the movie because of the violence. Although there is violence in the movie, most of it is indirect and actually very originally shot (as is the whole movie) --- but apart from that, Pitt's performance is just grand with his incomprehensible accent, not just to mention his performance in the boxing ring, which may also be appreciated by your girlfriend. By the way: I noticed one minor possible blooper --- when discussing about a camper for his mother, a dog suddenly jumps up to Pitt and that frightened him somewhat while uttering the four-letter f word, and then continued with his lines but with a smile on his face --- I don't think it was part of the script, though. Did anybody see this as well? Anyways --- great movie, I like it more than Pulp Fiction!

Review title: Style over content, but manages to work
Review_body: With the initial fear that Snatch would serve as little more than a Lock, Stock part 2, I was pleasantly surprised by what turned out to be a better acted, and in places, better paced second film by Guy Ritchie. Although at times the editing does much to jar the flow of the story, it still manages to hold the attention, and provides a number of great set pieces and laughs. Praised for his first foray in front of the screen in Lock Stock, Vinnie Jones goes one better in this film with an extremely good cameo. It is also great to see the underrated Benicto Del Torro in use, all be it under-used yet again. Brad Pitt manages to work a great comedy performance out of his boxing pikey, and, with the labourious Nick Moran and the ridiculous Dexter Fletcher dropped for this film, the acting seems alltogether more professional and more believable at every level. Ritchie shows more flashes of inventiveness, and with an amazing finale, Snatch will undoubtedly stand on its own merits rather than being dismissed as formaliac under-performance from all involved.

Rarely, if ever have I left a theater with a smile that big, and that unerasable from my face. Hands down the coolest and most entertaining movie of the year. Wonderful characters, absolutely hilarious and fast as is gets. The opening credits had me gasping for air. And it only cost six million dollars. That's spec

one of the top 3 films i've seen this year. very funny, very fast paced - an excellent follow up to 'lock, stock...' in my opinion. good performances by brad pitt, vinnie jones and especially alan ford as 'brick top'. u should definitely go see this film on a friday night with your mates.9.5/10

Review title: That dog....it had me in stitches!!
Review_body: I saw Lock, Stock when it first came out, and loved it, I knew it would be huge because of the love of gangster films flockin about at the time.When I went to see Snatch I was not expecting it to be that good, I thought it would be too close to Lock, Stock and everyone had already started to refer to it as a sequel, when it is clearly not.Snatch centres around a few people, but the narrator is an illegal boxing promoter called Turkish, who gets into trouble when his boxer is knocked out by an indecipherable Irish guy called Mickey, who is played brilliantly by Brad Pitt.There are alot of things going on here, but the good thing about this film is that they all get tied up and twisted around each other at the end, so there are no loose ends.I was surprised at the performance of Brad Pitt,  he's a bit too mainstream for me, but in this film his acting and accent are superb. The only bit I didn't like involving him is when he stares into the flames, that is a bit too much like a hollywood blockbuster scene.Anyway, overall I loved this film. Oh and the dog I mentioned, watch out for it, its soooooo funny!I give this film 9 out of 10

First off, let me state that the first time I saw Pulp Fiction, I thought it was "okay" (I later upgraded my opinion to "very good", but that's beside the point). I didn't think Reservoir Dogs was all that fabulous.But I am a sucker for a good caper flick, and Snatch was that.There were moments when it seemed like Snatch was straining, or trying too hard, but it succeeded in being good, stylish, fast, furious, and above all FUNNY. Even the moments when it seemed Richie was trying too hard managed to be witty and make me (as well as the rest of the audience) laugh. As a matter of fact, I haven't been in a theater where the audience was this spellbound in the past year++, and I haven't been to a movie that I haven't been able to preguess within the first 15 minutes in a very long while. That's the first thing you might realize about Snatch, after the credits start rolling -- it sneaks up on you -- you don't even realize that you haven't even TRIED to think about how it's going to end -- it just flies too fast, and too furious. It's no Usual Suspects, but it isn't trying to be. It earns a solid 8.5 in my book. See this movie. (And for those who are reading this while it is in the theaters, spend your money on this flick -- don't let Save the Last Dance, which is pure schlock, blow this one away in the earnings war).

Review title: A fun, hilarious, and clever flick not to be overlooked.
Review_body: First of all, don't make the mistake of labelling Snatch as the British Pulp Fiction.  Pulp Fiction and Snatch have nothing in common.  Pulp fiction rejuvaneted the crime genre in 94', so don't expect Snatch to do the same. Make no mistake, Snatch is an excellent film, yet it makes no attempts to hide what it is: a quick fun film.If not evident from his previous film, Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, Guy Ritchie is a director to watch.  Snatch is a slickly made film from beginning to end.  The spinning, freezing, zooming camera shots create a style distinctive to Ritchie.  If anything, Snatch is fun to look at.What really makes the film shine is the meandering and interweaving plotlines of the various characters.  Snatch manages to create numerous hilarious situations out of your standard steal the diamond bit.  The movie never slows down and will have you captivated from beginning to end.The number of colorful and varied characters make for fun dialogue, and accents.  Brad Pitt is hilarious and totally convincing.  Again, don't go in with any pre judgements (i.e. the a fight club mind set).  His role in Snatch eclipses that of Tyler Durden.  It would be futile to describe the rest of the excellent cast.  Oh, and then there's the dog (worth the price of admission alone).  Ritchie takes every chance he gets to poke fun at anything and everything, and it works splendidly.Snatch, though not wholly original is a gem.  Don't listen to the comparison to Pulp Fiction, just watch it and have a blast with this expertly crafted and slickly made film.  Nine out of Ten.

I can't put into words just how well this movie was made. I was originally surprised to see Brad Pitt in it because at first it seemed like a B movie at a time when Fight Club's popularity was through the roof. The acting done by all the actors in this movie are superb. The directing is superb. The sound...superb. The plot...outstanding. I must say that whoever wrote this movie sure is a funny guy because there are lines in this movie that i would never had thought of in a million years. The only bad thing i noticed about Snatch was it's partial leaving out of important information. So on a scale of -10 to 10...i give Snatch a -5 for the info thing, and plus several million for everything else.

Review title: Snatch is best movie of the year so far
Review_body: The cinemas in my city are so crappy about getting movies that are off the beaten path of the mainstream, that I was surprised we even got Snatch. I had never seen Lock Stock and the only thing I knew about Guy Ritchie was that he was married to Madonna. But some friends of mine talked me into going, and it was just fantastic. It had that hard edged comedy that Pulp Fiction seemingly invented. As a matter of fact, except for Fight Club, this may be the best movie that has come out since Pulp Fiction. This should definitely be up for an oscar, and Brad Pitt for best supporting actor. You can't understand a word he says but he still manages to say more than most actors do in a 5 minute monologue. Another highlight was Benicio Del Toro who, while not in the film for very long, steals every scene he's in. Vinnie Jones surprised me because I had never heard of him (I did recognize him though) and he was such a good tough guy. Now that this movie is out for rent, everyone can see it, and it is definitely the better choice than Save the Last Dance.

One of the worst movies ever made! The best part were the end credits. When it finished, it was like Handel's Messiah was playing in the air. No plot! No storytelling! No character development! But, it did have one thing... Just a bunch of silly nonsense and confusion!
Over cramped with characters going at tangents to each other. Avoid.

Review title: Not since 'Crime Story' has Farina had a role that is his equal!
Review_body: There is no doubt that Farina's 'coolness' is an attractive quality but it is his ability to communicate passion and depth of character in combination with humor that makes him worth watching.  As with so many roles that he has played, his contribution to this movie was limited by a dimensionless character.  When will he be allowed to bring his special brand of warmth and toughness to the screen?  He did that week after week in 'Crime Story' so that leads me to believe it's the writing and directing.  Think what he could do for example, if he were to play a man left with the job of raising a hot-headed 14 year-old grandson!  I'll keep the faith.  It's bound to happen soon or later.

Perfect! I have seen this movie about 7 times completely, and seen particular scenes umpteen times. You cannot get tired watching it over and over again. The acting is flawless. The direction is superb. And the story ... Fits in like a jigsaw puzzle. Benicio del Toro deserved a longer role, but was brilliant in the short one that he did get. Brad Pitt, Jason Statham, Vinnie Jones, ... Everyone rocked the show! The scene in the bar with Vinnie Jones and the three masked blacks was THE SCENE of the movie. Vinnie Jones did a similar role to the one in LSATSB but gives it a new freshness that doesn't let you get bored of him. Brad Pitt really impressed with the Pikey accent. Way to go Guy Ritchie. As long as you keep making movies without your silly wife in them, people shall love to watch them.

Here's a movie that doesn't let up for the whole 90 minutes. Apparently the first cut was 3 hours long, so Guy Ritchie cut out every frame that did not advance the storyline. The result is fast, furious and four letter word-ing funny. As with his debut film "Lock, Stock..." it features a collection of "large" London criminal types whose paths criss-cross chasing a significant illegal prize, in this case a stolen diamond.Oh, and the DVD is worth buying for the director's commentary alone.

I watched the DVD yesterday. Somebody had told me that this was a good movie. But I don't agree... it's brilliant! Wonderful story with lots of surprises, great acting, lots of laughs. Okay, there is rather a lot of violence in this film, but it's not too gruesome. I really enjoyed this film.

This movie is really dreadful. Like 'Lock Stock...' but 20 times more annoying. There are loads of famous actors (and Vinnie Jones), all wasted in stupid and underwritten 'character' parts. The dialogue is cliched mockney rubbish, the plot borrows totally from every other british crime pic of the last 50 years, the whole thing is just embarrassingly awful. In fact, the only good thing is Brad Pitt's performance as an Irish gypsy. Guy Ritchie should really stop pretending to be an east-end gangster and turn his talents towards something less annoying.

Review title: Snatch is a story in the telling
Review_body: Snatch is like a novel. Guy Ritchie handles scenes like simultaneous events in a Michael Crichton, or CLive Cussler novel linking them together as the story unfolds. Watch it for superb performances by Pitt and the rest. And most of all , this is a film where you can see the 'direction' Amazing. Oh. Watch it withe the subtitles.

Here is a movie I never cease to enjoy, the colorful characters, wittiest dialog ever and winding plot are the best. I wish Guy Ritchie would make more films like this, I know others have attempted, but few come close. Although Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels is fantastic as well. I was steered away from the film because of the title, but once you watch it, you'll understand why the name. Brad Pitt's performance is one of his best albeit a small role, and this breakout role for Jason Statham is the reason he is a major star today. There are other great characters like Bullet Tooth Tony by Vinnie Jones and other characters that will be hard to forget. I think if I could wear out a DVD, this is one that has been put through the paces. Anyone who has seen this is likely to have seen it a few times, and if you are 'movie guy' can likely quote at least 10-20 lines from the rich dialog.

This film is completely amazing, you'll find all possible elements to see in a movie! It is full of comedy, action, thriller and drama and even being everything at same time, it's really enjoyable and well made, far from the non-sense that are produced nowadays! It carries one of the best cast you'll ever see! Brad Pitt takes his best performance along "Fight Club", Benicio Del Toro, Jason Statham and too many more! The characters were well built, you'll really enjoy all of them, even the evil, the boring and the dumbs, they are all funny and enjoyable! The plot is so clever, simply one of the best I've ever seen! It's difficult to me to explain why, because English is not my main language! But I can afford without a doubt that even if you don't take 10 stars after see it, you'll at least respect it and probably keep one of the amazing scenes in your mind forever!

Review title: Guy has obviously a passion for these fast and energetic films, so don't expect any different from him, the question really is, are they really any good?
Review_body:
Guy Ritchie's Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, and Snatch, are almost completely identical films, (except maybe in the lengths of the titles) but they use the same narrative styles, storylines, themes and even characters. Guy has obviously a passion for these fast and energetic films, so don't expect any different from him, the question really is, are they really any good?The film 'Snatch' is based around a group of London's underground gangsters, criminals and mobs. Three individual storylines meet and part, only to meet again, and then part again, combined with excessively fast cuts and sequences this makes the storyline difficult to digest for the average audience member the first time round. These set of gangsters; however all are in it for the same thing, in some way or another, a diamond which is a big as a small fist. These are also linked to a group of sub-plots which weave into the storylines of the different groups in the movie. Creating a well defined storyline, although this for most of the film will leave the audience slightly disorientated. Of course because of films Black comic nature, half the characters are the same way.The editing style used in Snatch ranges from incredibly fast cuts and sequences, to slow and long dialogue's between characters, including a long monologue of the 'usefulness' of a pig's digestive system. Just because the film is in English, doesn't mean that we have gotten over the language barrier with international film yet, while the accent is much more understandable there are some characters who it seems even other characters can't even understand, an example being Mickey (Brad Pitt) who speaks in his own dialect only few have mastered. Overall the storyline is complicated to a degree that it makes the film unpredictable yet still understandable (well, maybe on the second viewing)The script is an interesting component of the movie as it creates some interesting characters, Avi (Dennis Farina), an American business man being only one example. However the storyline seems to cut in and out of storylines, characters and times too quickly, the beginning of the movie seems to introduce the characters too quickly then dumps you into the middle of the story. It takes some time for the audience to catch up with each of the groups within the story and figure out how each are related. By the end of the film the audience has just got to know the characters, and aren't really concerned for them by the time they make their 'exit,' let alone relate to any of them, although this would be an impossible task for any realistic person anyway. The characters are interesting and dynamic, but when it comes down to it not real and believable. However I agree with Roger Ebert in that: `.no movie can be all bad that contains the following dialogue:U.S. Customs official: 'Anything to declare?' Avi (Dennis Farina): 'Yeah. Don't go to England.' Roger Ebert (See Bibliography)
Guy Ritchie's 'Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels' follows a similar formula so those who enjoyed 'Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels' will most likely enjoy Snatch. However I feel this film was let down by an undeveloped and erratic plot. Ben Waugh

Snatch Review In 1998 Guy Ritchie released his amusing view of the British Underworld called Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels.  Now he's gone one step further with Snatch, which was one of the funniest movies I saw in 2000.  With an all-star cast this movie will have you laughing until you cry.  It is black comedy at it's very best. Starting in Antwerp, a man by the name of Frankie Four Fingers (Benicio Del Toro) holds up a diamond dealer and gets his hands, or all nine fingers if you will, on very large diamonds.  He then takes those diamonds to London and arranges a meeting with Doug the Head (Mike Reid), a Jewish diamond dealer. Meanwhile Franky wants a gun, so he goes to Boris (Rade Serbedzija).  In exchange for the gun, Boris sends Franky to the bookies to put money on an illegal boxing match.  This is a set up as the bookies are to be robbed by two pathetic, black porn brokers.  The plot now becomes very complex as the local crime boss Brick Top (Alan Ford) has been promised by the promoters Turkish (Jason Statham) and Tommy (Stephan Graham) that they will put up a fighter.  The contestant, unfortunately, is hospitalised by a bare-knuckle gypsy-boxing champion.  Meanwhile, the largest diamond is lost and everybody wants to find it including an American diamond dealer.  Sound simple enough? Describing this complicated plot is not easy because it is so intertwined. In addition, I don't want to give away the very amusing scenarios. The experienced and talented cast includes Jason Statham (The Transporter) as the sarcastic fight organiser called Turkish.  Alan Ford is the notorious crime boss, Brick Top and Brad Pitt (Fight Club) as Mickey O'Neil, the bare-knuckle boxing champion.  Vinnie Jones (Mean Machine) plays hard man Bullet Tooth Tony and Benicio Del Toro, who later wins an Oscar for Traffic, is Franky Four Fingers, a man with a gambling problem.  Dennis Farina (Get Shorty) is the impatient American diamond dealer Cousin Abraham 'Avi' Denovitz.  Rade Serbedzija (The Quiet American) as the 'hard to kill' ex KGB Boris The Blade/Bulletdodger.  Jason Flemyng (The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen) as Mickey's best friend Darren.  These actors play their parts so well that you feel that you are part of this underground criminal culture. The nicknames are so descriptive of each of the characters. Directed by Guy Ritchie, this film seems like a sequel to Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels.  The style and feeling is almost exactly the same. The way in which he weaves separate stories together as though they are viewed from different angles.  Since he is an English director he uses the typical Cockney slang that's common in the backstreets of London.  The script is very clever in the terms of how much that slang is being used and although one may not be familia with the expressions it can be easily understood from the context. The opening sequence is ingenious.  It moves from one person to another showing us who they are and what they do.  It also shows us how all of these people are connected and sets the scene for the interesting plot that follows. As much as I loved Guy's first instalment this is by far the funnier of the two.  Not only are the characters famous internationally but also they each play their parts to perfection reflecting their characters.  The result is incredibly funny and well mixed. Rating:  5/5 Stars

This is one of the best movies ever. Every dialog in this movie is a classic one. I know the entire film by heart. It is a master piece, not much more to say about it. Guy Ritchie is an awesome writer and director. And who would believe that an old football player like Vinnie Jones could play such a perfect role?

Review title: A Witty Film For Those England Lovers!
Review_body: An amazingly made film, about comedy, teamwork, and utter crime. I could not believe my eyes when I first watched this movie. It brought out so much inspiration for the young wannabe filmmaker, but may I forewarn you, it isn't for the faint of heart when it comes to comedy and blood. I have always loved British films, BBC Charles Dickens, Jane Austen etc. ever since I was a kid. But Guy Ritchie is one of the most astonishing English Directors of the 21st century in my vast opinion."Snatch" a brilliant story about how gluts and criminals fight over the goods. A mere diamond, stolen by criminals disguised as Jews brings a wide range of characters into a subject of mystery, death, friendship, and most important of all, money. Brad Pitt's acting is phenomenal and the dialog is hysterically astounding. My eyes widened as the plot got thicker and thicker. It drove me over the edge of happiness and enthusiasm to the point to where I fell into a pool of laughter and cunning only to which, I had to be "snatched" back into reality. 5 Stars!

Snatch is a brilliant, violent but often hilariously funny thriller about the lives of a gang of London low lives, as well as Americans, Irish travellers, Russians and the tough and shady world of underground boxing. I remember the film first causing a stir because of the casting of Brad Pitt against type as a rough Irish traveller and his supposedly incomprehensible accent. Pitt is brilliant as he hams it up but never goes overboard is a role that is a slight parody of his part in Fight Club. As with Lock Stock....Guy Ritchie keeps his cast of favourites and it shows, the acting is excellent from just about all concerned. Although for me as with Lock Stock.....it's Vinnie Jones who steals every scene he's in as the violent and menacing Bullet Tooth Tony. Alan Ford is also fantastic as the sly and shady Brick Top. Ritchie's assured direction never skips a beat, and his trademark camera-work is again on display, and editing techniques are second to none. Also the characters are wonderful and the script is first rate. The central plot is as old as the hills - criminals try to retrieve a diamond stolen from an Antwerp jewellers - but it doesn't matter. This is one the true gems of British cinema.

Guy Ritchie's film "Snatch" has been one of the most interesting movies that I've seen in a while, to say the least. Written and directed by Ritchie himself, the movie had two major actors that I was familiar with off the bat; Brad Pitt and Jason Statham. Released in 2000, this film tells many different stories at the same time through the use of creative cinematography and storytelling elements. We follow the story of two unlicensed boxing promoters as they're ensnared in the underworld of diamond dealing. Throughout the movie, they come in contact with various characters such as "Frankie 'Four Fingers'" and "Boris 'The Blade'". As the movie progresses, our characters stories intertwine, until their paths coalesce into a single plot, involving all the different characters introduced throughout the film. I would recommend this movie for anyone that enjoys thrillers and action films.

Quite possibly my favourite film. I've watched it at least a dozen times and I'm sure ill watch it a dozen more! There was still little clever parts i don't think i noticed until my 3rd or 4th viewing! Like when 'bullet tooth tony' orders a beer in the bar, the barman only gets halfway through pouring it when he sees 3 men come in with masks and guns, and ducks down behind the bar. Tony picks up the pint, looks at it funny and drinks it anyway.I love the characters in this film as well. Turkish and tommy are great together but my favourite duo is Vincent and Solomon. they are hardly the brightest criminal duo and when you add Tyrone in to the mix with them, they are just hilarious. The scene where they rob the bookies is one of my favourite of all time.Last thing id like to comment about this film is the amazing soundtrack! If i didn't already have them i made sure i downloaded every song after watching this film!

Review title: One of those films that will always be great
Review_body: If you haven't seen this film yet then go and rent it now. It is a must see for anyone with a good taste in films. I know that people's opinions are supposed to be just that; opinions. But this film is just brilliant. Fact. I can't understand how you can't like this film. Perhaps the accents will be a bit too much for Americans. I remember seeing an episode of Ripleys Believe It Or Not in which they used subtitles for an interview with an English woman. So I'm thinking that the Americans might have a bit of issue with the English accent. But it shouldn't be that much of a problem. While we're on this subject I have to say that Brad Pitt absolutely butchered the Irish accent but its OK because it was funny as hell. The only other problem I can think of that people may have with Snatch is the violence. It doesn't bother me in the slightest but I guess that some could be put of by it. Even if you don't like violence in movies I would still recommend that you see it, give it a try. In conclusion this film is hilarious and has a great story with many unsuspected twists. If you don't see Snatch you will regret it. Trust me, watch this film NOW

Review title: Brilliant! Guy Ritchie at his best!!
Review_body: Snatch is a typical story about gangsters and people trying to get hold of a diamond. What makes it special is the direction of Guy Ritchie & the performances by the cast. Franky Four Fingers, Turkish, Mickey, Cousin Avi, Tommy, all of them, are great characters. Most of the film is taken in a very comical way. The songs played in the background are really with the mood and is perfect! Slow motion scenes and action sequences are really well taken by Ritchie. One of the best movies of Guy Ritchie (Like "Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels). This movie is a must watch. Go for it."ANYTHING TO DECLARE? YEAH! DON'T GO TO ENGLAND!"

Reading the background of this movie I didn't expect it to be as good as it was.. I was so wrong. I absolutely loved this movie! The storyline and plot were so well written and executed throughout the movie I couldn't have been more entertained. There was a movie made after Snatch called Red it was made in 2010 and the films to me are similar; not just because Bruce Willis stars in it but because the balance of comedic elements with Crime elements were similar. They both made you laugh at the same time they were doing something illegal, which in turn sort of made you look past certain scenes and focus mainly on the fact that you were laughing at something and ignoring that they were doing things that would break laws. It also seems similar to me because in the movie Red there was a man that walked around with a stuffed animal because it was filled with something and in Snatch they have the dog that swallowed diamond which in both films added to the comedy. Overall I loved this movie and I 100% recommend it to anyone.

Well what is there to say other than this film is a truly tantalising portrayal of Gangster England! It really comes through where so many films i.e. Hot Fuzz, really get inspiration from and really takes you from one extreme to the next and with the transitioning from character to character. All being perfectly articulated throughout with a good quality amount of sarcasm and banter. A Funny, witty and intriguing masterpiece of film for sure!

This is without a doubt, one of my all time top 10 movies! The script along with the cast to deliver it with impeccable timing and conviction has made me watch this movie time and again with the same enthusiasm and euphoria! Great cast of British actors with a young Stephen Graham is a winner 9/10

Review title: best movie of all time hands down
Review_body: just like the headline says this is the best movie ever made of all time no matter what ever comes out none can touch this movie. Snatch is the poo and everyone should give it a good whiff then scoop it up. I don't know how this movie didn't win some kind of awards besides at the film festivals...I'm thinking the academy is crazy rite now...i mean how the hell did this now win for cinematography or best actor or even supporting actor...there where only 3 girls in the film that spoke and they didn't talk much weren't all that hot but this wasn't about that this is a mans man film and even my lady friends love it. Everyone i know has seen this mostly because i sit them down and make them watch it but then they all went out and bought it because its the best movie ever.

Like I said in the intro, just put on this movie and sit back and relax and allow yourself to be entertained. Guy Richie does a masterful job of assembling an all star cast and giving them all an opportunity to shine. From Brad Pitt to Jason Strathom everyone seems to actually enjoy being involved in this movie and as a result, they have put on a stellar performance. The action is nonstop and the storyline moves along at a great pace as all the parties involved speed towards each of their ultimate resolutions.
Way too frikin complicated too many plot twists and acting isn't great either

Maybe I don't have much to add given that others have said a lot already. I loved the movie, and especially the few scenes involving Brad Pitt."It turns out that the sweet talking tattoo-sporting pikey is a bare-knuckle boxing champion which makes him tougher than a coffin nail!"I keep watching this scene over and over on Netflix, and it never gets old :)

Review title: Absolutely flash film from Guy Ritchie!
Review_body: First off, I can't believe this kooky $3-million movie came to our local cinemas, we usually only get the $100-mil blockbusters.  I saw it twice in the theaters and bought the DVD as soon as I saw it.  This is the kind of quirky, dangerous, offbeat humor the intelligent moviegoer can really sink his teeth into; toss in a couple of characters you care about, a couple of characters you really want to see get hurt, a storyline you don't expect, and add some way flash dialogue.  The musical choices made for this movie are perfect; I downloaded a couple of singles from the soundtrack and then just went out and bought the cd.  If you enjoyed Get Shorty, Pulp Fiction, or Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels, do not wait one more minute: you must go now and rent this film.  After this and Lock Stock I can't wait to see what writer/director Ritchie comes up with next.

Snatch the new film by Guy Ritchie is a mainstream masterpiece. And without doubt the best movie, not to mention most descent move of the year. Almost all movies this year thus far have been complete c**p. All hype and not living up to its word, something which Hollywood is fond of. However Snatch rises above all that jargon and comes out as a sly comedy that is well acted and even better written. I came into the theater and kept telling myself that this wasn't a direct sequel (although it did use most of the same actors from Lock Stock) and to watch it as if I never knew Guy Ritchie's work, and it worked. But some viewers might find this hard due to the fact that Lock Stock was such a good movie, which it was. But in my opinion this was better. The movie itself is very high paced and fun. So if you live in the U.K and have a hole burning in your pocket, go see Snatch. Your pocket and your head will thank you.

Review title: Lock, Stock and Smoking barrels the sequel
Review_body: Same plot and story line as his (Guy Ritchies) last movie, Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels. If you enjoyed that movie you will enjoy this one. It's entertaining, but there is nothing new or different about it. There were times when it was really hard to understand what the characters were saying.

Review title: Good. But too much like Lock Stock
Review_body: Snatch is a good film, I liked it. But whilst watching it you can't help but feel that you're seeing an alternate version of Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels. Vinnie is playing the same character. The plot is based around a bunch of people trying to obtain something for an gangster boss in exchange for their lives. Similar sorts of comic situations. Etc.I personally felt that the "original" was funnier, better directed, and with a better balance of characters. Although Snatch is a good film, I would have enjoyed it more if I hadn't spent much of it feeling I'd seen it all before.

snatch...OOooh a masterpiece of a movie. Guy Ritchie is an excellent director and writer..his former masterpiece Lock,stock and two smoking barrels just blew the roof and was to become one of my favourite movies but now he suprises me again with Snatch ,a movie wich was Lock,stock.. times two. Snatch involves superb character's and cool names. It's several histories wich is connected around this one item, a huge diamond. All the seperated histories meets in the end and it's just excellent.

Gross, disgusting, senselessly violent film masquerading as an art film. And the Brits say that Americans are violent.  No redeeming value.  Throw it away if you bought it - better yet..return it and demand double your money back.  People who think this is a good movie are the reason there is so much acceptance of violence in America.

Guy Ritchie's new film Snatch is a deal, it's steal, it's Sale of the Fu#!ing Century. With plot twists in every new scene and countless amount of characters. This movie is a piece of classic comedy. And not corny U.S. comedy or Yabbo Australian comedy. I'm talking up front smart England Comedy.Guy Ritchie really shines in the criminal underworld of England genre making almost every thing said in his movies funny. I being a big fan of Lock, Stock and 2 Smoking Barrels I built up a lot of anticpation for this movie. Though not as good as Lock, Stock, Snatch certainly lived up to my expectations and I must say is outstanding work.Snatch has two seperate plot lines which managed to be pulled into each other. Mostly thanks to one awesome dog that swallows, not spits. See this movie and you will not be disappointed

I saw this at a preview showing 5 days before it came out in the UK and am glad I did.  Well what can I say basically 'Snatch' is 'Lock Stock' but with a diamond.  However, don't let this distract you from what is a very funny, well-shot and visually enjoyable film.Guy Ritchie propels the story along with blistering pace trying to fit a fast range of characters and in some cases this can become confusing to who is who and what is what.  In any normal case this would make the film a poorly put together piece however, it is down to Ritchie's exciting visual style, which keeps you, hooked to the brilliant ending.  You certainly won't get bored cause of the amount of images being throw at you, is incredible.This all round down in an astonishing final fist fight involving Brad Pitt, which mixes all the elements before hand into a visual adventure, with every trick included 10 times as good as any fight you will see in 'Fight Club'. All I say is that don't go and see this film and expect to see anything different to 'Lock Stock' in the story department, however, if you liked Ritchie's stylist touches then you will defiantly enjoy this cause it is full of them.  Enjoy.

Review title: Now that was worth 10 bucks !! (18 with soda and popcorn)
Review_body: It has been rare that I have walked out of a movie theater and was pleased. Guy Ritchie is able to keep the pace fast and moving at all times.  I would have given it a 10 if it weren't for the 'ard to 'ear accents.It is such a well done ensemble cast that not one character overtakes another (particularly with stars Brad Pitt and Dennis Farina.  The humor is witty and at times very understated but enough to make you laugh out loud (many many times).With all the crap that is churned out of Hollywood, it is refreshing to see a film that comes across as though it was crafted by professionals who love their work more than making money.GO SEE IT !!!!!

Review title: I've never seen a Snatch as great as this
Review_body: This is a fantastic film and easily ranks along with Lock Stock and two smoking barrels. For all the similar traits between the two films they are both very different.Snatch brings a much more serious slant on the London gangster scene, with more menacing characters. The film however retains a great deal of humour and sideways slant at violence and crime.The dialogue is very sharp and Brad Pitt character is a masterstroke - employing one of the most sought after actors in hollywood to play an irish, illegal boxing gippo.Richie must carry on his rise to stardom, by picking his next film carefully and steering clear of another london gangster flick or casting his wife.

LS&2SB was a wonderful film.. Came out of nowhere and I loved it.Guy R did a really good job in that one.. He (quite deservedly) must have gotten quite a large ego because of it.Unfortunately though, he let his ego run away with him. Snatch will be a moderatley good late night movie 3-4 years from now, but right now - fuggedaboutit.He tried, as in LS&2SB, to interweave several seemingly disparate stories into the one. Unlike LS&2SB where it worked brilliantly, Snatch just came off as a "hmm, it worked well last time" kinda flick..I could go on for ages, but couldn't be bothered as I don't even remember the specifics (saw it last week).

Review title: Brad Pitt is no pretty boy anymore, and he keeps that trend going
Review_body: This movie was bad-ass.  The acting was incredible, and the stories were great.  The fact that a movie can make you laugh when people are dying only makes you see the movie in a greater light.  This movie had everything action, laughs, a fat guy with a British accent, a dog, a diamond...and oh yeah Brad Pitt.  Now I'm not saying that because i think Brad Pitt is hot, I'm not like that.  No I'm saying that because Brad Pitt is one of the best actors in Hollywood right now.  This is thanks to his departure from those sappy, Meet Joe Black type movies, and his roles in movies like Fight Club, and now Snatch.  He makes one of the best performances of his career and I'm glad it is in a good movie.  Everyone should see this movie and I garauntee you won't be disappointed .

Review title: Guy Ritchie is a ONE-TRICK PONY!!!
Review_body: Guy Ritchie is a one-trick pony.  However, that trick of his sure is entertaining.  Ritchie captures that same quirky spark of humor as seen in 'Lock, Stock, & Two Smoking Barrels' and puts it to work on his latest outing, 'Snatch'.The similarities between the two movies are quite evident, but the nuances of every scene are inventive enough to have equalled the highest expectations I'd held for it.Don't expect it to win any Oscars...but it is one of the few recent movies that is worth spending money to see.  A comic gem (no pun intended).

Review title: Snatch was good, but Lock,Stock Was much better!
Review_body: Now while Snatch was a good movie, I was disappointed that it was just a copy of Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels. Lock, Stock is definetily the better movie by far, a completely original, very funny and amazing film. Snatch did have it's moments but was a very predictable movie especially if you've already seen Lock, Stock. I just hope Guy Ritchie's next film won't just be another copy of these 2 films!

Review title: Best Movie So Far This Year!
Review_body: Last night I was lucky enough to get tickets to the sold out showing of "Snatch". I was blown away. Clever plot, excellent story, awesome cast and outstanding editing and DP work. I highly recommend this movie. 10 out of 10.

Excellent, that just about sums this film up.Fast moving, clever storyline entwining (a la Pulp Fiction), great action and very funny to boot.I found the violence not too gratuitous, and the comedy very British, and very funny.Yes it is smells a bit of 'Lock, Stock...' and as earlier stated 'Pulp Fiction' but this is a must see. Brad Pitt is excellent and his accent is great. Vinny Jones plays another great role, he is turning out to be a better actor than how he played football for Wimbledon thats for sure.The rest of the cast are great too, with Mike Reid (of Eastenders Fame) and Dennis Farina (Get Shorty) on top form. I loved the storyline and how it was shot. Fantastic.To sum up, go and see it...."Before 'ze germans' get here"...........

If this movie doesn't get an oscar for best movie of the year then they can close down the the academy awards!The people who wrote/made this and the guys that acted in it... THANK YOU, it was really an 84 carat movie!!
A great movie overall I love this movie one of my favourites, with its iconic quotes, great cinematography and memorable story line.
Great movie. A must watch. Dhjjhhgffyukoigvkkokbghjijjjiugfryjjbgji

Review title: More of the same, but you can't complain about that
Review_body: During one of the first scenes of Snatch, I got worried.  I was worried that Guy Ritchie was a fraud(well not so much a fraud as a fluke.)  While Franky Four Fingers and his crew were stealing the diamond in question, Ritchie utilized this cheesy camera technique of zooming in real fast while turning it at an angle, I looked like a bad music video, or someone trying to look like Guy ritchie, and it looked way to polished)not to be confuded with good)  Anyway, this turned out to be a misconception on my part, as the rest of the film blew me away.  Ritchie is certainly a talented, even revolutionary filmmaker. I keep hearing alot from critics about how his movies have too many characters, the plotlines are too convoluted.  I couldn't disagree more. Ritchie deftly rolls out story lines weaves them together, and keeps you guessing til the very end, all the while spewing out classic lines of dialogue.  His frenetic pace, although not at all traditional among the film community, is representative of modern pop culture, and works magnificently if only you let it. Anyway, I can't believe anyone would have a problem with being exposed to all these great characters anyway, Ritchie truly has a knack for creating awesome, fleshed-out and altogether sordid characters.  Even though some of the ones in Snatch were really just re-hashing of ones from Lock Stock, everyone has such an individual quality that makes them stand out on their own. Also, I really want to point out what a damn fine actor Alan Ford is, and that Brick Top is just about my favorite villain EVER.BludgeoN

Go see Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels I know the idea was to build the box office, but why do we need American actors intruding into British film? Come on, Guy! Did you have to make another crazy-mixed-up crime comedy again. And what's with the comic book openings? There were some funny bits. After slugging through a very slow beginning. Jason Statham and Stephen Graham were perfect as Turkish and Tommy. The pawn shop guys (Lennie James, Robbie Gee, Ade) were funny together too. Though he has been good in many things, Dennis Farina was at his worst. And Brad Pitt, I'm sure he studied hard on that accent, but he is just not right for this film. And haven't we seen him get beat up before? I didn't walk out with many of the other patrons, but I was disappointed.

Review title: One of the most exciting and innovative movies I've ever seen.
Review_body: Awesome movie!! Excellent story, visuals, casting, soundtrack, etc. etc. etc.!!! A must-see mind boggling adventure. This movie has made Brad Pitt, Vinnie Jones and Jason Statham my three new favorite actors. Guy Ritchie is a cinematic genius.

This film is unquestionably one of the best film of the last decade, many give that accolade to "Pulp Fiction" but this is better than anything Tarantino has come up with and Ritchie has a better ear for dialogue (and that's saying something). If people can get over the fact that this is set in cockney London and not cool L.A. than they'll agree with me. If your still unsure weather to watch it just watch it for the Pitt performance.

An absolute classic. Watched over 20 times at least and gets better every single time. Quality from the acting was fantastic, the plot is so silly at times and it's superb. Guy Richies genius this movie. Bravo.

Review title: One of the best British Films
Review_body: A fast paced, hilarious British crime comedy/thriller.A great follow up to Lock Stock from Guy Richie, (where did it all go so wrong for him???).A superb array of interlinked characters who help the movie flow seamlessly. This is also Brad Pitt's finest hour in my opinion, despite being unintelligible for almost the whole film! You watch the film and your loyalties for the characters changes as the film progresses, basically wondering how it can work out OK for all the characters, you won't be disappointed by the ending though. Basically watch this film, you will enjoy it tremendously!

If the movie had been set in America, with all the characters American, and all the accents American, people would have screamed that "Snatch" is merely a "Pulp Fiction" ripoff. I guess giving people accents really does seem to add style and originality where there was none to begin with.

Review title: Best movie I have seen since the Usual Suspects.
Review_body: This movie has all the great things- Comedy, tragedy, drama, irony, revenge, extortion, murder, and a great soundtrack to boot.  I have to admit I didn't know what the hell was happening at times but the ending made it all worth while. This movie reminded me of The Usual Suspects, which is my favorite movie, so if you liked The Usual Suspects, you'll like this movie. Worth renting, if not buying, which I plan to do. Could have used a sexy female co-star, though. Could have used more of Benicio del Toro, also. Brad Pitt was great, Dennis Farina was great, and Vinnie Jones was excellent. Guy Ritchie proved himself to be a great director.

Review title: One of the best British Movies ever.
Review_body: Snatch is a superb masterpiece by Guy Richie which amazed me after my first viewing. It left me speechless. After the last 16 viewings of it, I still enjoy it as much as the first viewing as every time it amazes me. It was the first movie which I bought on DVD and it was a risk as I had never seen it before. It was proberly the best $40 I have spent all year as it has been thrashed on my DVD player. The bonus cd on the DVD has some surprise specials in it with some hidden bits in it including a lot of swearing from the movie. The movie itself is exceptional from the humour between Turkisk and Tommy to the hostility between Bricktop and anyone who gets near him. The movie includes some great one liners that I have repeated many times since such as 'You can't underestimate the predictability of stupidity' Bullit Tooth Tony. The camera shots by Guy Richie are amazing from the quick zoom onto Turkish and Tommy when Mickey drops the other boxer with one punch, and also the shot of the guns showing REPLICA and DESERT EAGLE .50.I have discussed with many people what is better between Snatch and Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, and most people cant decide. If you have only seen one of the them you must watch the other as both are great movies and that is why I gave both 10/10.

Review title: Snatch is a brilliant Directorial masterpiece from Guy Richie
Review_body: This is my film of the year, after watching it once I coulden't get enough, Its a film you can watch more then once, in fact more then 10 times. The film is about a diamond, while a lot of storys are going on a once it all boils down to the one thing, The Diamond. Excellent performances by Brad Pitt, as well as everyone else, while a serious film it is a mix between comedy aswell with Sol, Vinny and Tyrone providing some great laughs. Now onto Guy Richie, he has made this film superb, the music is brilliant, the camera angles is great and the parts from introducting all the characters to the part where Avi comes to London. The boxing scenes are great especiailly at the end.What more can I say about Snatch??Great Film, Great Music, Great directing, Great actors, Great story, Great comedy, In general go and buy it and I gurantee personally you will not be disapointed. I give the film a Strong 9.5/10 and agree that it is much better then Lock Stock!Adaceg

Review title: Excellent comedy (funnier version of ANALYZE THIS)
Review_body: In my expeience of movies this movie is the funniest movie i have ever seen. Eventhough i hate comedy movies this movie has single handedly changed my opinion. Its a must see for anyone who wishes to laugh till their nerve pops.
Snatch was a spectacular Movie with a mindblowing script . Everything was perfect from the beginning to end. The comedy,the directing,especially names of the charaters😂.

This is great. Not since "Pulp Fiction" have we seen better interweaving of plots. The accents _are_ somewhat confusing at times, but I believe this is done on purpose (really, would Mickey be as charming if you knew what was going on?). The theme music is nice, and the profanity - though used quite often - is not used in a way that can be found absolutely offensive. It's more casual swearing of everyday language than it is somebody trying to shock somebody else with their language.All in all, I applaud Guy Ritchie for his brilliance.

Review title: Packed! Must've been tough keeping the film as short as 104 minutes.
Review_body: Definitely a film to buy for keeps! Unlike the movie "Unbreakable" (which I still maintain, should have been say 30 minutes long), this movie is packed with so much action. So much so that many scenes had to be in fast-forward, with others being omitted so that you the viewer can fill in obvious blanks. Like most sequels (if I may call it that), it borrows motifs from "Lock Stock". It however manages to remain original and (have I not mentioned yet?)very very interesting
I enjoyed this movie, it's really great, with a different experience from all the movies.

So today I watched this movie Snatch, directed by Guy Ritchie. What an amazing movie!! A delight to watch; I mean I had heard that movie but this good.I had never expected.So the movie is basically about all these criminals trying to snatch things from each other. Story starts when a man named Franky Four Fingers smuggles an 84 carat diamond to London to sell to a jeweler on behalf of his boss. And then a lot of crooks and biggies get involved. And everyone is trying to snatch something from others; hence the name Snatch. Now this storyline may seem very familiar to you; and in a sense it shares some flavor with The Departed and Babel, but the real killer is the way story is told. I have got to give to Guy Ritchie. I mean what a comedy! The criminals in the movie are not white collar ones, they are the bums for whom crime, violence, theft, debauchery is a way of life. And each of them has his own idiosyncrasies; which ultimately screw him up at some point or another. And still all of them continue so nonchalantly through all the mess. And I just can't describe to you right now how great the way story is told is. One of the best I have ever seen. And the performances from all the characters are mind blowing. Especially the one from a character named Bullet Tooth. And as for me, it showed me the world in way I had never seen.So I would highly recommend this movie to anyone who likes gangster movies in general and would like to watch a hilarious spin on it.

Review title: The Best Movie I've Ever Seen
Review_body: Snatch is most definetely my favorite movie of all time, and I've seen quite a few in my time. Every detail of the film is worked out perfectly and the casting is excellent. Its similarity to Pulp Fiction is visible, but not too eminent, and it is a lot less bloody than Pulp Fiction. The writers of this movie tried to be very original and in my opinion they succeeded greatly, creating some of the most hilarious characters and plot twists. Although this movie is a little excessive in violence, it doesn't have so much that you just want to turn it off. And the swearing in the movie adds to the comedy perfectly. When it came out it wasn't advertised that widely which I think is a good thing because movies with too many previews are no fun to watch because you go in knowing the plot. This movie was a total shocker for me because of the British humor, which I love, and the wonderful acting. Benicia del Toro did an excellent job and Jason Statham was very good as Turkish. This Movie definetely deserves an Oscar or two!

I actually had no desire to see this movie...but my brother practically forced me to watch it and after i did....i wanted to watch it again... The characters were so funny and yet believable at the same time.  I loved Brad Pitt in this movie b/c he wasnt used as another pretty boy...the character of Turkish (also narrater) was my absolute favorite.  If you had reservations about seeing this movie discard them and get it.  Its funny, thrilling and keeps you guessing as to what is going on.

... but I'm going to try to describe it anyway...The characters: Every character in this film is a fabulous story alone. Sure, most of them are only one- or two-dimensional, but those dimensions we do see are hilarious, twisted, and unique. Nearly all of them are selfish, violent, mentally ill, loveable criminals.The plot: A bizarre tale of back-stabbing, lying, cheating, and all things illegal. The story twists and tangles over itself like a nasty ball of twine.The filmmaking: As surprising and entertaining as the story and people. The camera is very much a character in this movie, and made me laugh and shake my head in wonder.See this film at least ten times. I promise you'll get something new out of it with each viewing.

What can i say? From the story to the cast everything is perfect in this movie! The fight scenes are awesome, the way brad Pitt talks is a little touch that makes the whole difference, the jokes made by the characters, and even the characters themselves are funny as hell.It's a movie with no fear of being different and original, with simple and little touches that make seeing it time and time again not a bad thing since every time you see it you pick up another great detail you missed the last time you saw it and that is what makes it so good and enjoyable.10 out of 10 no doubt in my opinion

One of the best fight scene in a movie, great performance by Brat Pitt,He almost single handedly steals the show but everybody should see Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrel. Original, not to confound with Quentin Tarantino, it's not the same thing, it's not a pale imitation.

This is one of the best movies I have ever seen! All the characters are so brilliant. After my opinion this is Brad Pit's best movie till now. I love the dialects in this movie, there is a gipsy dialect which Brad masters very well,irish,russian,regular english and Brick Top's way to speak english. Brick Top is the coolest character in the movie, he is a mafia boss who's teeth are in very bad shape and he has some very funny comments, like: "feed em to the pigs" and "im sweet enough". This movie is a master piece.

Review title: Guy Ritchie is an amazing writer/director
Review_body: Guy Ritchie is so talented.  HIs movies has a mixture of wit and mayhem! His stlye of writing reminds me a lot of Quentin Tarantino.  It's funny how both of their styles are so alike.  I really love to watch more of Guy Ritchie's films and it's too bad he only directed like 3 movies. He should make a gritty british gangster flick like The Getaway game on ps2. If he won't maybe I'll take the inituitive to write the script myself and have him direct it.

While my friend was suggesting me this movie for quite a long time, I finally managed to bump into it and have become a Guy ritchie fan.Well hats off to the way the movie has been crafted. Be it some out-of-the-world characters portrayed, top class performance by some biggies(read Brad Pitt), dark humour, camera work, background music; everything makes you wanna watch this piece again and again. I quite liked the way various characters were introduced. Also the script is very well written in a way that it needed a tremendous effort to interrelate so many happenings and make something meaningful out of it at the end. But everything seemed to fall into place so smoothly that you don't even feel any glitch whatsoever.Guy ritchie has not only recreated the magic of Lock stock and two smoking barrels, rather he took it one level higher. If you appreciate dark humour then it's a must watch for you. A warning though, don't watch it without subtitles. There are so many accents that you'll definitely loose the grip on the movie without subs.All in all it's a 9/10 for me and I would recommend it to everyone.My fav dialogue from the movie...Brick Top: In the quiet words of the Virgin Mary... come again?

No movie has been able to make me laugh as hard as the time I saw Snatch for the tenth time.This is just the perfect comedy.Brad Pitt, the part when he was upset about his ma's death is a masterpiece.Every time I see Vinnie Jones in this flick , I wonder why he is not one of top comedy stars of the decade.The way he proves to 3 black guy why they should f*** off , is simply hilarious as hell.Vinny , Sol and Tyrone just show you How 3 normal guys can be the funniest thing on the planet.That stupid smile of Vinny before introducing the shotgun to Sol gives a nonstop 2 minuets of laughter each time.Brick Top is a bad ass dude that you love " Do you know what nemesis means?" The couple of Tommy and Turkish are the stupidest thing you can find.Turkish seems to be a calm and serious guy but his every single word has lots of comedy behind it.Guy Ritchie just proves that he is one helluva Director and Writer.Some of movie's line are historic , like : " It's Mickey Mouse " or " You can never underestimate the predictability of the stupidity " or Avi's moaning about nobody speaking English in England.The Hare coursing/chasing Tyrone scene and Tony driving the car while having someone's head stuck in it just are unique samples of creative and funny.So I recommend all of you to see the movie ASAP , Before " Zee Germans " get there!

This movie was the coolest movie I've seen in a while. In fact, its one of my favorite movies now. It is hilarious and the ending is awesome. It's worth seeing the movie just to see Brad Pit pull off the gypsie trailor trash accent.

Review title: The second mark Guy Ritchie has left in film.
Review_body: Guy Ritchie yet again delivers a fast-pace, dynamic combination of story, visuals and soundtrack, making sure that there isn't a dull moment for the audience to drift off on.the story is centred around a diamond, naturally all the characters want in on its wealth so the plot thickens, a race between characters to the valuable prize.of course the obvious question is, how does it compare to the famous lock, stock and two smoking barrels? Guy Ritchie clearly left a signature on his first film, fortunately this is carried on to snatch and could be developed even further to create more exciting sequences and more compelling scenes than ever before. Guy Ritchie shines so obviously through the film and doesn't let you forget it was him who directed this cinema masterpiece.

Marvelous movie. One of Brad Pitt's most impressionable performances, competing with his jaw-dropping role on 12 Monkeys. His character makes the movie, his mannerisms, his accent, his way of handling situations, his insane personality; every bit of his amazingly executed role adds up to the magnificence of the whole. Another actor worth mentioning is Benicio del Toro. Apart from the fact that he is a puertorican just like myself (and we puertoricans take that seriously) , he plays an excellent role. This is evident because even though he is cut off half-way through the movie, the impact of the persona of the character he plays stays with us 'til the end. The acting performances of these brilliant actors make the movie. The plot is good, and very well set forth, but the characters displayed are simply wonderful. I mean, who doesn't like seeing Jason Statham play a bad-ass delinquent that drinks milk? From a carton! I know I sure do!

I have seen this movie more than five times! It is an amazing one to watch, it has all the ingredients for a successful movie, the plot is interesting, lots of amazing and unique characters, the accents used in the movie are impressive, and finally what brings it all to good closure is the unpredicted sequence of events. I do not know of many movies that are similar or even come close to the greatness of this movie. You can get many quotes out of this movie and it never gets old or dull. It should be rated as one of the top 10 or 20 movies ever made.I have it and I recommend others to own it!

This is a horrible movie.It's boring. The story plot line isn't that interesting. It drags onand it even easies up. None of the actors are good in this turkey.I didn't laugh once during the whole movie. I don't know how it evengot made or made any sum of money. I was surprised that it has such ahigh rating here on IMDb. The only good part was with the 3 thievesbecause that was kinda funny but honestly it wasn't it was just thefunniest part in the movie that wasn't funny. Avoid watching thismovie. I give it a 0.

Review title: If you've not seen this, Snatch it from the store right now.
Review_body: If you've seen Lock, Stock and two Smoking Barrels or not, it doesn't matter (Although i rate that film highly).This isn't this huge blockbuster movie, but it doesn't need to be.
