The budget is clearly low, but that gives it so much more character.Brad Pitt is brilliant in his role. As well as the "sneaky F****** Russian".The film almost has a Pulp Fiction to it. Crime film with lots of story lines which all link in throughout and then come together at the end. A very quotable film as well as Lock, Stock. Vinnie Jones makes a huge improvement in her performance from Lock, Stock.Some good songs throughout which instantly make you want to jump straight over to YouTube and listen to them.Try and pick this film up with the box set along with Lock Stock, and enjoy some twisted, rude and hilarious cockney gangsters getting into all sorts of shenanigans with there mates!

Hi ...Just questioning Boris's name in the film. I thought it was "Boris The Bullet-Dodger", but on here they are referring to his name as "Boris The Blade". I guess it doesn't matter much, and it has been a while since i've seen this kick-azz film, but am I right or am I right? =)Putting that aside for a sec. (Please comment on his name!) I think this is one of the best movies i've seen. Big call I know, but I enjoyed it that much! Pitt's characher was amazing (Pikey) in that I really was struggling to understand him! & that punch of his ... OMG! Pretty tough =) I do like the whole "London Gangster" genre, although movies like The Transporter really drag the chain.

Snatch is a fixed up cocktail of just the right ingredients. From the unlucky underground boxing manager (Jason Statham) to the inarticulate fighting gypsy (Brad Pitt) to completely incompetent jewel thief's, these guys make up a cast of characters that are utterly hilarious when put together. The witty dialogue makes the movie what it is. I feel wittier just by watching it. As an American, its just amusing to hear these quick-tongued Brits go at it. Nearly every scene involves a quip or sly remark. Cop: "What's in the car?" Turkish: "Two seats and a steering wheel." But beyond the cunning wit of the dialog, you have a story of a group of lowlifes, thugs, gangsters, hit men, and gypsies all trying to get the same thing, whether they know it or not. Although, its more like two completely separate stories are being played out simultaneously, but end up converging into one in the end. I won't get into how or why, you'll just have to watch it. My only quarrel with the film is, if you've seen Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, you'll notice a lot of similarities between the two movies. In fact they're almost exactly the same in terms of general plot techniques. Even used some of the same actors filling similar roles. While this isn't enough to discredit this film, I actually think Snatch is far superior, it makes me wonder what Guy Ritchie was thinking.

Review title: Maybe one of the best(if not the best)comedies ever made
Review_body: "This movie rocks!" You know that line don't you? It really does rock. I've seen this movie more times than I can count!:) I can watch it every day, and every time it'll make me laugh. Everything about the movie is great. The script, the cast, the soundtrack. Even though the movie is a bit MTV-video-clip-like it still is great. You don't even notice these things until after the movie has finished. The leading actors are great. Jason Statham is one of the best actors these days. Alan Ford also gives an incredible display as "Bricktop". He is just amazing. Benicio Del Toro is also great. He isn't in a lot of scenes, but whenever he is on screen you immediately get to like it. The story is perfect for this type of movie. Diamonds, money, England, funny accent, funny characters. The "Pikeys" are EXTREME. You just love the accent. When they tell Turkish and Tommy they want a caravan for Mickey's mom and the two of them can't understand what are they saying, or when they are betting on the field about the last match and the rabbit. It's just amazing. And the one-liners are great. Just great. My favorites are Alan Ford's "Do you know what nemesis means? A righteous infliction of retribution, manifested by an appropriate agent. Personified in this case by a horrible c-nt. Me!" and Jason Statham's "Protecion from what? Zee Germans!" I give this movie 12 out of 10. Watch it. WATCH IT! NOW! You'll not regret it. This is one of the finest movies ever.

Review title: Cockney Gangsta's were never so cool!
Review_body: Foul mouthed, gun wielding, double 'ard b**tards is what the film and its promo suggests, and this is exactly what you get. The plot is comical and serious at the same time, following a relatively credible (if a tiny bit far fetched) course of events and on the other hand, its just a bloody good laugh. How many people who liked this film will refer to a jumbo jet the next time someone moans about the size of a parking space! For anyone who finds reasonable strong language, violence and the kind of content that makes it the '18' rated it is, then this film is a definite no no. I on the other hand, find this film one of the most memorable films for its comedy content and unforgettable quotes. Many an off the cuff comment between my friends and I are sourced from this film, and it is a stable choice for a night in with a few beers! If you liked Lock Stock , then you should see this if you haven't already. But from the great film this is, its not likely that you haven't! 10* class A comical Gangster movie. H'avvit!

Review title: Possibly the most overrated film on IMDb
Review_body: For anyone who holds any love for the English accent, steer clear of this film; Statham's performance simply crucifies it and he's by no means the only performer guilty of this crime. I'd have been more convinced had the casting directors pulled people off the streets of London and that's no joke, so to have Statham narrating throughout was a painful experience. This fundamental flaw left the whole film difficult to take seriously and moments that were clearly meant to be funny were simply awkward.Brad Pitt's performance, however, was excellent - although he barely features.3 out of 10

Review title: Amazing, This is the best movie ever made.
Review_body: Without a doubt the best movie of all time. "Pulp Fiction"-like plot with flawless acting and directing. There is no doubt in my mind that no other movie will ever be made that is even close to as good as Snatch. Guy Ritchie is an incredible director, and I cant think of more than 1 movie that has a better cast than Don Cheadle, Brad Pitt, Jason Statham and the dozen other unbelievable actors in this film. You will never again see a movie that is as good as this, it is as well written, acted, produced, and directed as ANY other movie in the history of film-making. An absolute must see, if you only see three movies in your entire life, make it Snatch, Pulp Fiction, and The Matrix. (The three movies are listed in the order in which it is most vital that you see them before you die.)

Review title: This is piece og genius from Guy Ritchie & Co.!
Review_body:
An absolutely brilliant movie! 👍
I have seen this several times and never her tired of it.There have already been written enough descriptions of the plot by others.

I completely agree with Zafoid. This movie is the best ever made. I love all the actors/characters to death. But no one seems to notice Tommy. He's my favorite. He acts so well in the crying part and everywhere else. Just take moment to spot the genius. Brad Pitt became my favorite actor thanks to this movie too. I can go on and on for days explaining how i love every detail of the movie, especially the soundtrack.Every song. Even the trailer has amazing music. I repeat. The best movie ever made. Second best is Lock,Stock & Two Smoking Barrels, Ocean's 11, Ocean's 12. You have got to see those movies. But they will never win Snatch.
This was the movie that made me love CINEMA. Guy Ritchie told this in a exquisite way. Brad Pitt's accent is impeccable.

Review title: It will snatch a hold of your attention
Review_body: Everything you like in a dark gritty dramedie! Action scenes shot amazingly to compliment the fun and humor along the way

Had never heard of this movie and feeling lucky we picked the movie, Snatch. I loved it although at some points the accents made it difficult to understand the dialogue. Brad Pitt though, played his mushed mouth, multi accented dialogue to perfection. The action was non-stop and this is an entertaining movie. .
Guy Ritchie made this in his prime, dialogues , soundtrack, camerawork - 10 points !

Review title: An excellent film about London's crime underworld.
Review_body: Of all the films I've see (and trust me, I've seen a lot of them) few films are as slick, stylish, and fun as "Snatch." The film involves several different stories all intertwined by a large diamond, a group of pi-keys, bare-knuckle boxers, a London mob boss, a trio of black thieves, Vinnie Jones, and pigs. The story, or should I say stories, are connected through many twist and turns ranging from the violent to the funny. Basically, if you like crime films, British folk, and good old fashion dry humor, then "Snatch" is a movie you need to see. If not, give it a chance anyway. And, if you still don't like it, don't blame me.

Review title: Looking to be entertained-- and nothing else?
Review_body: Neither Guy Ritchie or anybody has outdone themselves with this film. It's mediocre enough and exaggeratedly mainstream, but then again there's no shame in earning the day's due pocket cash is there? Although the film quite obviously disguises some clumsy acting with a varying of delightful accents that doubtlessly pull in the non-British/-Irish audience, the overall production does marvelously for what it's meant to be: pure entertainment. It's very funny, very light, with a kick-ass soundtrack and accomplishes the ever-loved concept of turning hateful realities of violence and butchery into buffoonery.It's a fantastic popcorn-beer-and-joint movie. Watch it!
I watched it with subtitles on, didn't want to miss a thing. I loved it!

Review title: No life-changing message, but artistic and *thoroughly* entertaining.
Review_body: I can think of no other film that surpasses Snatch for pure entertainment value.  What's more, certain sequences are brilliantly artistic and the plot exposition occasionally approaches genius.  This is one that every film aficionado must see.

First off let me just start by saying that I've read most of the user comments and for those of you who have bashed this movie, you need to take it for what it is and supposed to be. I understand one's right to his or her opinion but really, for those of you insistent on bashing the work of others, why aren't you making films? This movie was meant to be fun that's all, it's not a view on the world or Guy Ritchie's solution to the world's problems. If you wanted that maybe you should've stayed home and continued to watch the 'Real World' or 'Survivor'. Something made you see it and I can definately say this was a well thought out and clever movie. It wasn't the best movie ever (as I guess many of you thought it would be) but I'm almost positive it wasn't meant to be either. Go see it and judge it for what it is...fun!

Review title: Everything that Fight Club tried to be
Review_body: This movie will blow you away! Although in essence, Guy Ritchie has just made a slicker and more creative version of Lock Stock, this is a movie that feels far superior to the original.The plot balances humor, tragedy, violence and just plain "gangster-cool" perfectly, and has a complete air of unpredictability from start to finish.The general standard of acting is high, with Vinny Jones showing a great improvement over his Lock Stock performance and Brad Pitt stealing just about every scene he features in.To summarise: If you want to see an intelligent, fast paced and funny film and can stomach the violence and ignore the fact that it is a clever rehash of it's prequel, then you will have a ball!And if Fight Club disappointed you, then get yourself down to see Snatch! It's everything that Fight Club tried to be.

I felt like i'd seen the film 10 times before.  Mr. Ritchie, you are about 5 years late with this one.  "Get Shorty", "Out of Sight", and "Pulp Fiction" were better AND earlier.  Brad Pitt is good as usual (as of late).  All i can say is....boooooooring!

Off-beat directing, filled with unexpected humor and convoluted character relationships. Brad Pitt is amusing and effective, Vinnie Jones is marvelous, and Jason Statham directs the viewer through the movie with the necessary glue. I could have sworn that the director had done either Pulp Fiction or Fight Club. Definitely worth a second viewing, to re-examine relationships.

A great follow-up to "Lock, Stock and 2 Smoking Barrels", Guy Ritchie uses a talented cast to bring together another frenetic tale of crossed paths and out-and-out stupidity. Benicio Del Toro uses his violent tendencies from "Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas", Brad Pitt is losing teeth again as a cunning Gypsy, Dennis Farina seems fresh out of "Get Shorty" and Vinnie Jones is reprising his head-slamming Big Chris role, now even more of a hard-a**e with some unique dental work as Bullet-tooth Tony.Full of laughs, full of gut-wrenching scenes, don't forget to take your Cockney interpreter with you, you'll be speaking it for weeks.

I really looked forward to watching Snatch. Not only was it from the director of 'Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels', one of my favourite UK movies of all time, but it had Brad Pitt in, who since Twelve Monkeys and Fight Club is my numero uno cool actor.But I ended up greeting many of the attempts at humour with a stoney face, found some of the images (notably the one with the body bags) just gross and distasteful and the entire plot lacking in the FUN that had been Lock, Stock.The plot didn't seem to weave as much - the diamond changed hands predictably, the comedy dog wasn't and some of the gags were so...sitcom-like. Ooooh...a fat man having trouble getting out the car.The characters were bad too. Ah, he has a cockney accent that's all  we need to know about him. Ah, everyone f***ing hates Pikies. That's funny repetition.The violence didn't fit with the cheeky style the film attempted...It makes me angry to think how much better Lock, Stock is. And it's a warning to ppl making a 'next' movie - change the plot, setting, chracters, tone, etc. so that comparisons between two movies are left abstract.Snatch is the half-backed sequel to Lock, Stock. But Ritchie sold out earlier than Lucas. If you look carefully you can see Ewoks everywhere.....or is it just lack of originality?

Guy Ritchie has recreated what he did with LockStock and it is true that Snatch is cinematographically a more accomplished movie than his full-length debut.If you were a fan of the old movie (that is having seen it 10+ times) you will be disappointed, otherwise it truly is a great and entertaining movie.This should probably work well in America where LockStock was not as big as it was in England.7/10
What a great movie ,fast, furious, outragous comedy and cockney slang to top it off.my fav characters ?  Vincent and Sol bricktop, and tommy.a Must buy on DVD and a movie to watch over and over

Guy Ritchie has outdone himself and bettered the classic, 'Lock Stock'. 'Snatch' may seem  very similar to Ritchie's first film and its spin-off TV show at first, but fears of it simply being 'Lock Stock 2' are quickly laid to rest.The acting from Vinnie Jones, Brad Pitt and Jason Statham amongst a whole host of others is top notch. While the script and plotting is fast and funny, leaving you wanting more at the films conclusion.It's definitely the best film of this year and thus this century too. Put simply, a must-see movie whatever side of the Atlantic you live on.Now repeat after me "I hate f***ing pikeys!"

Review title: I don't know anything about this movie because I was asleep
Review_body: My guy friends loved this movie, but I was asleep within the first fifteen minutes. However, I didn't fall asleep because I was tired, but because I was bored. So I don't know anything about it, except that it was not worth it to pay six dollars for a nap.

Review title: Gun blasting, fist flying action and then theres our Vinny and Brad....
Review_body: This film is a blast and a must see for all of you.  I reckon that if this had been released b4 'Lock, Stock.....' then it would have got more acclaim than it will now just for the fact that it is more of the same.  Parts of Lock Stock creep through ( vinnys opening scene, similar characters, classic one liners) while being good, does make you think that Guy Ritchie has played the safe option of using tried and trusted material as opposed to something more original. The characters are good - Boris 'the blade' is a great character just for the fact he just wont die!!, Brad Pitt suits playing the irish boxer down to the ground.  Some good use of alternate camera angles and you have an entertaining film - possibly the best ive seen this year (except SHAFT). 8 out of 10

Review title: i have never seen brad pitt in such a good movie
Review_body: ive never seen brad pitt in such a great role. its guy ritchey at his best i loved the movie its been my favourite since ive seen it i loved benicio del toro too he was tremendous ive never seen such a good movie as snatch i recommend people to see this movie.

Review title: From the opening scene it shocks you
Review_body: For those of us who are sold of the cliche that for a movie to be good it must have the world's biggest cast and budget, snatch is a delightful reminder that good movies are made because of good storys and that's exactly what snatch is, a wonderous 2 hour acid trip like experience that you can hardly understand yet you understand that you want to watch. Brad Pitt is golden and near mno names Jason Statham and Stephen Graham (Turkish and Tommy) are revent and convincing in their leading roles.

Review title: Simply the best comedy this year !!!
Review_body: I think the kind of humor in this typicly English movie is far supirieur on the American humor. It is hard to describe, but if I have to, I should say it's Tarantino movie in UK style. Everybody who loves this movie should also see Lock, Stock and two Smoking Barrels. It is also a movie directed by Guy Richie.

Funny, well directed but unfortunately NOT original. Same plot with "Lock Stock and Two smoking Barrels". Anyone that has seen that, will understand how similar the two movies are. The truth is that I expected something more from the director as I was thrilled when I saw his previous movie "Lock Stock...".

I was lucky enough to see this movie at a special preview and being a huge Lock Stock fan I was concerned that this was going to be a massive let down. How wrong I was! Having expected the worse, but hoped for the best, the movie delivered far, far more than my highest expectation. It was visually unique, funny, serious and bizarre all at once! Vinnie Jones again steals the movie with a great performance, showing the way to a fabulous cast. When this movie opens, its going to be huge, see you at the Oscars Guy!!!!

Having liked Lock, Stock... a lot, I came to this with plenty of expectations and received very few surprises. It does all of the same things as Guy Ritchies first hit - some of them better and some worse. The plotting was if anything even tighter, the script funny in parts but far too much of a retread to produce much in the way of real laughs. Brad Pitt was excellent and featured in practically every memorable scene in the film, which came as something of a surprise to me. The greatest disappointment for me, though, was the selection of music for the soundtrack which was decidedly lacklustre - even moreso in comparison with the truly excellent soundtrack which accompanied Lock, Stock...

Snatch - Guy Ritchie and the cast and crew should grab a load of Oscar nominations for what is the best film to come out of the UK since...Lock Stock & Two Smoking Barrels.If you enjoyed Ritchie's previous work, then you're guaranteed to like this cleverly interwoven tale of diamonds, dogs, dodgy geezers and dead bodies. You'll even notice some striking similarities to Lock Stock, as once again we see Vinnie Jones modifying someones skull in a car door!However, there's plenty of new twists and turns to the tale, and far more humour than I was expecting, which the whole audience seemed to enjoy enormously. Brad Pitt does well in his role as One Punch Mickey, but be warned, you'll find it difficult to understand anything he says, but this is all part of the plot.Without doubt, some Politically Correct interest group will bleat on about the potential racial stereotyping of gypsies, but it's a film for God's sake, and a very good one at that. The soundtrack is one of the best for a long time, and it's stylish without ever being in danger of being pretentious or over-elaborate.See it, love it, buy the T-shirt - aren't preview screenings great?!?!

Guy Ritchie and the boys show that Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels was just a launch pad.Snatch juggles more characters, more convuluted plotlines and more gags than Lock, Stock, and is a far more satisfying treat.The cinematography is spot on the money, slick without looking like a commercial. The soundtrack is pumping, and even manages to fit in a (personal joke?) Madonna track.Every principle, of which there certainly are a few, turn in excellent performances, bringing their cartoon character gangsters to life. Bullet Tooth, Four Fingers, Brick Top? Do people really have names like these?Brad Pitt manages to invent a whole new language (pikey), Mike Reid shows he does have a life outside of Eastenders and smutty stand up, and there's even a chance for Ewen Bremner to roughly reprise his role as Spud in Trainspotting.Catch it before ze germans arrive.

Review title: Guy Ritchie has done it again!
Review_body: After such a classic piece of cinema, like "Lock, Stock...", you'd think the pressure of making his second full length film, might weigh down the plot or direction. I'm happy to say that Guy Ritchie has done it again, making a movie that will no doubt become a classic action film. Set in London, "Snatch" is the story of Turkish and Tommy, two unlicenced boxing promoters who get in trouble with a gangster named Brick Top. Turkish's boxer, Gorgeous George is supposed to go down in the 4th round but when Tommy and George got into some hot water with a group of gypsies led by Mickey O'Neil (Brad Pitt, in one of his best performances). George gets into a fight with Mickey and Mickey knocks George's lights into the next world. Turkish decides to substitute Mickey for George in the big fight but when Mickey doesn't go down in the 4th, Turkish and Tommy sink deeper into trouble.In another plot line, jewish diamond thief, Franky Four Fingers (Benico Del Toro) steals a diamond "the size of a fist" and is then robbed buy 3 stupid jewelry wholesalers and their crazy gypsie dog. But they run into one small problem, the case with the stone in it is chained to Franky's arm, so they take Franky with them to meet the buyer, russian ex-KGB assassin, Boris the Blade. Back in the USA, Cousin Avi (Denis Farina, playing another foul mouthed mobster) finds out that Franky has been robbed and he won't get his giant diamond. Avi flies to London and must find his 86 karat stone with the help of Bullet Tooth Tony (Vinnie Jones) a man who took six bullets to the head and is still tickin'. He even had some of the bullets molded into teeth to replace the one's he lost. Sound complicated? Don't worry, it's not. With his brilliant directing style, Richie has made a movie that will make you laugh, cry and maybe even puke if you have a Really weak stomach. Plus some of the best boxing sequences filmed since "Raging Bull" Any way you slice it, "Snatch" is a winner! 10/10

Review title: "Lock, Stock And Two Smoking Barrels" Revisited
Review_body: In 1998, when "Lock, Stock..." came out, Ritchie was relatively unknown, and that was part of the charm of the movie.  The comedy was refreshing, evenso with visual effects and story teller tricks;  the great surprise was the "everyone"-finale.  The movie was an alternative and commercial hit, which is not an everyday achievement.  The conception of "Snatch", however, cannot be driven by anything different from commercialism: it is an exact copy of "Lock, Stock..."; Ritchie didn't even try to hide it.  Plot, characters and effects are exactly alike - to give an example, the only change made to Vinnie Jones' character in "Lock, Stock..." is the name.  What makes it even worse, is that Ritchie needs visually not entertaining features (stills, name-tags, arrows) to tell his story.  Two highlights, however, are the performances of Alan Ford and Mike Reid: as evil as can be, and therefore entertaining.
This is what I call a phenomenal non-stupid entertaining movie with great musical beats.I simply loved it.Ritchie is finding his way...

Phew! What a movie. Mr Ritchie really knows his stuff. Action, violence and humour - the perfect combination for a (near) perfect movie! And how about those names - surely One Punch Mickey, Doug the Head, Brick Top etc are the best aliases since Reservoir Dogs. Can't wait for the next one...

Not a bad movie, but somewhat predictable (You know : everybody cheats everybody). Lock Stock ... was better in my opinion. Snatch has a tendency to just be the same as the former. The characters tend to be too 1-dimensional. Even when Brad Pitts 'mother' died, I couldn't really relate.

It is Quentin Tarantino a la "Trainspotting" style. Taste of British humor makes the big difference from other modern "tough guys" films of American origin. Acting excellent, in particular Dennis Farina is in another amazing role after "Get Shorty".

Review title: been there, done that, but it still kicks butt!
Review_body: okay, most, if not all, reviews of "snatch" inevitably state that it is exactly like "lock, stock, and two smoking barrels," down to plot twists, dialogue, characters, and actors.  this is true.  "snatch" contains all of the elements that made "lock, stock" a major hit.  but it does it even better.  so what if guy ritchie's script and direction is nearly identical? he's given "snatch" a better script and better actors.  the script is just marvelous, the camera gimmicks are more entertaining and enhancing than pretentious.  and brad pitt gives his best performance as a gypsy irish who is even more indecipherable than benicio del toro's mumbles in "usual suspects."  mike reid as brick top is utterly frightening, boris the blade is hilarious, and the scenes with tyrone, vincent, sol and the dog are unbelievably funny.  go see this movie. it's fast, furious, and an absolutely wonderful time.

When I entered the theatre to see Snatch, I had some idea of what to get. But I got a little surprised as well. I had read some reviews of the movie, and they were telling me that this was a movie, pretty similar to "Lock, Stock & Two Smoking Barrels". And the movie was, by all means.But sometimes there is more to a movie than just the plot. Consider the details that you experience in this movie, and you'll know what I mean. First of all, the "Gipsy-Pitt" is a geniously played part. You'll understand 50% of what Brad Pitt is saying, but that's how it is supposed to be. Another detail that is excellent, is the cutting from L.A. to London. Three small cuts, that is mixed together, and makes it understanding that a person leaves from one city to another. Great details here.As when it comes to the actors, I would say that the two best ones here, is Benicio Del Toro, as a gambling diamond robber (by the way a good Rabbi), and Brad Pitt as a ravelling gipsy. Two genious actors that is escalating the complete picture.Overall, go see the movie, and judge by yourself.

Guy Ritchie. I'd never heard of him before seeing this movie and looking it up. He is brilliant. Snatch was entertaining and then some... it was well written, fast paced, funny, full of action, etc. And I love the more "artistic" directing style. The characters (which there were alot of! I loved the intro!) were excellent and the dialogue was great. I don't normally write reviews for movies on here, because I'm never quite sure what to say. And I don't like to give anything away (heck, most movie previews do that for you). But I basically wanted to mention how much I enjoyed this film. It's one of the best I've seen in awhile.

Review title: What can I say about Snatch? Well, it is one of the greatest movies I have ever seen.
Review_body: Ranking up there with Pulp Fiction, Boondock Saints, and Fight Club Snatch is an incredible film.  It is hilarious and action packed.  The way the web of characters terminally weaves together is fantastic.  Of course it contains the neccesary adrenaline pumping violence that movie lovers of this genre crave, but beyond that the dialogue and plot are brilliantly crafted. This movie was off the charts.  I would have given it an eleven if possible.

If you like movies with multiple story lines and some dark comedy, then you will truly love this movie.I watched this movie only 3 times in the first week.You really need to watch it at least twice to pick it all up.The accent used by Brad Pitt was a bit difficult to understand, but after a second or third viewing the context was intelligible.There are great characters, with some really awesome lines. If you like to quote lines from movies, then this will really give you a lot of material. Probably better than Crash and 11:14, though those are also good movies with multiple story lines.A great flick.

Snatch...What can I say other than this is one of the best films that I have seen in the theatre in a long time(along with traffic). I am a 16 year old male currently in 11th grade. I went to see this flick with numerous people from my school, who all enjoyed this movie a lot. Even the girls liked it. This movie was stereotyped to be another pulp fiction, and it was not completely different, but I would hate to choose b/w them. I loved everything about this movie, the comedy, the action, the fighting, the drama. And especially the accents, they were incredible. The movie would not have been the same w/o them. I usually do not like Brad Pitt for the types of girlie movies that he does, but when he goes into a role like this one, he is incredible. Just like he was in Seven. I dont want to bore you with an essay about a movie, cause I am 16 and dont feel like writing one, so i'll say this: Snatch is a great movie, but not the best movie to see on a date. Because you may spend more time watching the movie then you will with youre date. Unless she likes action/comedies. In which case youve got a hell of a girlfriend. GO SEE SNATCH!!!! Thanks for youre time. -Bryan

Best Guy Ritchie's movie ! Fantastic cast !
I love this movie !
...but with a better cast, better direction, more wit, more action, and more laughs.  Do not listen to the quibbling critics.  See this. It's a hoot.PKL

Review title: Good film, but a bit heavy on the accents
Review_body: I know that Brad Pitt's thick accent in the film is a running joke throughout the movie, but his isn't the only one. Most of the actors are hard to understand. However, definitely worth seeing, and one for the DVD collection.

This is an cracking,fantastic,outstanding movie,with not only gun-fights,drugs-deals and a interesting and fascinating story,it also has good humor and classy actors,with magnificent acting. Brad Pitt,as always he's totally into his role,and plays the person like it was really him,the accent.Vinnie Jones,really cool,brilliant acting. This is a MUST,you must see it,really the acting amazed me and i this is one of the best movies I've ever seen!!!!!!!

Review title: A fast-paced action film, one of the greatest of it's genre!
Review_body: This movie was tremendous.  It immediately attacks the senses with a pulsing soundtrack and amazing camerawork from beginning to end.  Brad Pitt gives a performance that is both hilarious and rousing as pikey boxer Mickey. Benicio Del Toro's character, Franky Four Fingers, doesn't get the camera time he deserves, but definately steals every scene he's in.  Go see this movie now!

Madonna must be a perfect match for Guy Ritchie because he's clearly more interested in making pop videos than movies. The direction is way over the top, the characters are all one-dimensional east end stereotypes, and it's just impossible to buy into his romanticised view of thugs and criminals who are a bit dim, a bit cuddly, and alright blokes when all's said and done. Yes, Brad Pitt's Irish boxer is great but it's the only highlight in an otherwise dire film. I'm ashamed that an Englishman could come up with this kind of tripe.

I thought this was a great film; from Brad Pitt's gypsy brogue to the quick and witty jokes that one so often witnesses in the criminal world. Although, I was still having trouble understanding just what everyone was saying, i still enjoyed the fast-paced action and clever camera work.

Review title: Guy Ritchie has made an all time classic
Review_body:
I remember 1st seeing this after lock stock & 2 smoking barrels (which I can add is an awesome Brit flick), so I was eager to see this definitely. My god, this has got to one of the most funniest & cleverest dark comedies I've ever come across. With excellent performances from an all star cast (vinnie Jones, Jason statham, Alan Ford, Brad Pitt, Mike Reid plus many more) you can't go wrong at all with snatch. It's not just the line up of actors that keep you intrigued.... the way that guy ritchie has made this movie is unique to say the least & absolutely works (e.g. innovative camera work, a various soundtrack that will appeal to everyone, & a wise cracking narrative by statham). Plus the way that the storylines of all the characters interweaving is very original. The main source of the all the events of the film involves the aftermath of a stolen diamond that's worth a lot. So be prepared for a hilarious mixture of characters... 2 naive boxing promoters, a gypsy that plays by his own rules, wannabe diamond merchants, a scene stealing psycho gangster with an obsession of pigs, inexperienced armed robbers. Plus there's many more characters that are gonna make you entertained from start to finish.
I definitely recommend snatch to almost anyone

Review title: gratuitously violent, especially regarding treatment of dogs
Review_body: This movie showed several scenes of the underground dogfighting world as a casual sidebar to the unlicensed boxing main theme. In one scene a guy, who you already know is a serious bad guy, is jabbing a stick in through the cage bars at a Pit Bull-type fighting dog which you can hear yelp, while the camera pans across to show the bloodied carcass of another dog who didn't survive the fight he was just put into, while the scarred victor stands nearby.  All of this happens in a part of the movie which is supposed to be darkly humorous. It wasn't -- it was disgusting. Anything that portrays animals in this manner is revolting.

Review title: They spent how many millions on this?
Review_body: When "professional" movie people decide on a project and spend millions of dollars, (pounds in this case) on a long shot gamble, it must hurt like hell to see results like this.  I say long shot because the script would be full of dialogue like: Mr. Pitt,  "Mumf orf tooz isgmos".And scenes like: Cut to Russian shoots principle character in the head, killing him.Cut to scenes and dialogue out of other movies(why is being eaten by pigs so popular these days?).Cut to Disney ending with all the bad guys dead and the good guys smiling.What could possible be going through these people's heads when they ok'ed this movie?

Snatch is hilarious! One of the best movies to come out all year. Thanks to snatch and lock stock and two smokin barrels I will now got to see anything Guy Ritchy does! It is also very simalir to Lock stock an two smokin barrles, except instead of a diamond its drugs everybody is after.

A truly outstanding movie, with marvellous characters and a great cast. The directing is enjoyfully intense, creating an atmosphere of real-life yet maintaining its surreality through some almost cartoonlike scenes. Even the dialogue is witty not to mention the superb music, which truly enriches the movie for the better. Most importantly, this is a concise moviegoing package that does not let the viewer down. See it and Enjoy!

Review title: Quick paced, love the British Humor..
Review_body: I love the British humor tied in through the twisting plot. A lot of my friends complain it was too confusing, but i feel the confusion is what makes this movie great.  At first i didn't like the fact that Brad Pitt (one of my favorite actors) had such a small role but after watching it i see that the dimunative role that he plays makes him that much more memorable. I definitely would like to see Guy Richardson come out with another movie with the same feel as this one.

Gypsy English > British English.Gypsy English > British English
Gypsy English > British English
Gypsy English > British English
Gypsy English > British English
Gypsy English > British English
Gypsy English > British English.

this film is one of the best i've ever seen - if you haven't seen it already, i suggest you go watch it. i love how the two separate stories mold together, and the jokes, the story line, and basically the whole thing. i also love how the gypsy camp looks like an actual gypsy camp! if you've ever been through one, you'll know what i mean. the boxing scenes are totally awesome, too. i especially love the end fight, and the end shooting got my sitting on the edge of my seat. it also portrays england really well. heh, of course. *thumbs up* go watch it, now :P you wont be sorry. and i'm aware that some of you think this film is a pile, but this is just my opinion!

Review title: One of the best Movies of all time !!
Review_body: This is without a doubt one of the best movies I ever seen, and I think that it is a movie experience for everyone ! so do yourself a favor and go see it now !! This movie is a classic, or at least it should be. The thing I like the most about this movie is that you follow a wide cast of characters so mix it all together and you got one hell of a movie.

Enjoyed it very much. Good gangster movie. A lot of plot lines going on. Statham did a great job as did Dennis farina. The bad guys were very good bad guys. Brad Pitt did a great job as the Gypsy. His accent was very funny. A lot of original scenes unlike some gangster movies, that rehash dialogue and scenes. Many funny scenes too. The dog was a great add on to the movie. Being from NY not used to hearing all these English phrases that were used in the movie. Fight scenes were done well too. Watched it with my family and we were all laughing. They enjoyed it as much as I did. We love gangster movies and this one kept our interest.

This is definitely my favorite movie. For me, it surpasses even the Godfather in greatness. Its basically about a stolen diamond, and the twists and turns it takes through several very entertaining characters. I have seen this film probably 30 times, I can quote everything before its said, yet it still makes me laugh. The British humor in it is very funny. I also really like the music. If you havent seen this movie, you should.

Review title: one of best comedies you'll ever see
Review_body: It is quite hard to describe in words just how good snatch is. In all honesty it is one level above. There are not many films that can match its calibre. Guy Ritche is a brilliant director and all his cast are just as brilliant. its of the best films i've seen a long time along with goodfellows, fight club, analyze this and american beauty. it will never fail to brighten your day.

This is such a excellent film , it's so witty. The best part of the film is probably the connection between Turkish and Tommy they both compliment each other so well. Another good part of the film is Brad Pitts role. Not because it's so well acted (although i'm not saying it it's not because he does carry the Pikey accent extremely well) because he is not treated like the one and only star like most Hollywood actors are. So hats off the Guy Ritchie for making it not only a fantastic film but it's so equal from the actors point of view. It's only a matter of opinion but to me it has the best memorable quotes from any other film! Five star!

Review title: There are two types of cockney gangster films. There are big brave Guy Ritchie films and there are little mincey faggot films
Review_body: This one of my favourite films to date. Its got everything from interconnecting plots to funny characters intriguing dialog about Pigs, Milk, a rather accurate depiction of London (supplied by Dennis Farina) and of course a "Sweet-talking tattoo-sporting Pykie". If you loved Lock Stock you should not miss this movie it's all about stealin' stones (or rather one stone) and breakin' bones (and lots of 'em). Guy Ritchie is the UK's answer to Quentin Tarantino and Snatch is his Pulp Fiction. It's all up hill from here for Ritchie.

I did not expect that this film would be so good. I enjoyed it a lot, and I suggest it for everyone that want to see a good film that's not so common. The story is so rich, and Brad Pitt is proving at each film that he is a great actor.

Review title: Snatch versus Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels.
Review_body: Did anybody out there prefer Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels? Although I, myself, am a big fan of Benicio Del Toro, and Brad Pitt was excellent, I thought the predecessor had a slightly more raw quality to it, as it was not quite as polished off as the Hollywood version.Albeit, Snatch may well have been funnier, but I'm always one to tip my hat to that which presented the really original idea in the first place. Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels was absolutely its own thing, and therefore gets extra points from me. And seriously, nobody beats Sting. And I also thought Vinnie Jones' character had an extra irony to it when he was always trying to set a good example for his son while beating in people's brains. Also, that ending scene to LSTSB was terrific.A lot of what made Snatch so great was the cinematography, but a lot of that was directly taken from LSTSB, as was the juxtaposition of subject matter and music.

Review title: Lock, Stock Pt 2 with bells on
Review_body: I know some people have criticised this film for being basically a re-hash of Ritchie's first film but I really enjoyed it nonetheless.The same convoluted plot stylings have been kept but now Ritchie has access to some much better actors ( Pitt, Farina etc).My favourite parts were a) the interaction between Turkish and Tommy, b) the hare coursing scene and c) the final climactic boxing scene.Worth noting is that the DVD contains some excellent extras, in particular 'the making of..'. It must have been great fun on set.Overall most entertaining, but I do hope Ritchie leaves this genre alone for quite a few years.  8.5/10

Review title: fresh film in the Hollywood mediocrity
Review_body: Snatch is a fine film. It is a way to look through today´s world. One might say that is a strange film, an  odd movie that sometimes annoys you... but it is not that way at all. it is in my opinion an artcraft of modern cinema and Guy Ritchie is one of the best film directors of the moment. he is a little bit like Tarantino...perhaps more strange in fact. i do recommend Snatch with no doubt.

Review title: An intelligent comedy with terrific characters and a well thought plot. May need to watch it a few times too truely 'get it'.
Review_body: I can't get enough of this movie, Snatch has to be the most well-thought out comedy ever to grace the screen. I'm not a big Guy Richie fan, but I must commend him for this one!I can watch this movie 4 or 5 times in a row and still never get bored with it. Be careful tho, some people just aren't sharp enough to keep up. ;)
I was so immersed time and space meant nothing to me in that 104 min.

Greed. It's everywhere if you just look for it. The fact that the film is called Snatch shows the main theme of the movie. The word "snatch" means to seize something in haste, which shows that greed is the motivational factor for all characters in the film. Vinny and Sol's use of fake guns b/c they were cheaper than real ones. The movie ends with the circle of wealth still being passed on to others. Boris shows his greed in the scene where he cuts off Franky's entire arm, he obviously only needed to cut his hand to get the suitcase, but took more than he needed. Recurring instances of pigs show greed also, sausages, Brick Top's pigs, etc. When the dog is given the toy, it greedily swallows it whole. Many instances of fighting for money. The movie has a widely diverse cast, which shows the interaction between cultures for the purpose of trade. Each of the character's names represents a common quality of their individual culture. In most societies, Men are dominant in the making and handling of money. This is why the film has no females in it's cast. Women are shown mostly with wealthy men, possibly possessions of these men. Greed is brilliantly presented in subtle and extreme ways throughout the entire movie. It makes the film more interesting to watch after you think about this.
Damn good comedy that doesn't need to exaggerate any scene with no stupid joke, fall or blow, this movie just works so well, if there's any word to describe it is brilliant.

This movie is one of the best movies I've seen in a long time. It ranks right up there with Pulp Fiction, Fight Club, Se7en, and others. It's paced really well and has likeable characters. The story itself is amazing and it's put together really good. I recommend this movie to anyone who is a fan of Tarintino, and Robert Rodriguez. It's amazing.

Review title: Not even brad pitt could save it
Review_body: If you like really strange, revolting movies maybe you will like this one. Some of my guy friends convinced me to go see this movie and it was so horrible I couldn't sit through the entire thing, and neither could they! Not even brad pitt (who is a great actor in addition to being beautiful) could make it worth watching. It was the worst movie i've seen in the theater in years.

Possibly the most loathsome film that I have ever had the misfortune of encountering. The script a joke, the direction a joke, the story a joke, characters a joke. Not a joke in the ha ha sense but in the sense that you wish you had more than popcorn to throw at the screen.The main problem with this picture is that it is trying to be something which it is not. A - it tries t be humorous B - it tries to be original and C - it tries to be that great white elephant, cool. Possibly if one hadn't seen Lock Stock... this would have passed the time with a slight modicum of enjoyment. But no, we get a rehashed, regurgitated, reject. The witty raconteur between characters in the "Bleedin' barrel o' cockney monkeys" (to quote the Fast Show) style becomes irksome and boring after about five minutes. The characters we have shoved in our faces have all the grace and subtlety of a deranged mongooseBut my main bugbear is the direction. It can only be described as 'CRASH' cinematography. I'll try and explain. 1) Cut from previous scene. 2) Loud music with heavy beat. 3) Man/ woman walking. 4) Said man/ woman stops walking. 5) Said man/ woman says something witty to other character. 6) Other character retorts with something equally witty. 7) Cut to next scene and repeat.When I watch wrestling I may enjoy this style, but I would rather wrestle a bear with an eating disorder than watch this drivel again.

Review title: Black humor, violence, action, great acting / directing and great soundtrack
Review_body: This is definitely one of the best movies ever made, due to the outstanding performance of the actors, the storyline, excellent directing, an enormous amount of humor, some violence and finally a superb soundtrack. All this is well mixed up by Guy Richie, who just knows how to make a great movie.

Review title: Some of the funniest dialogue ever captured on film!
Review_body: This is a terrific movie. It has some of the funniest dialogue ever captured on film! The characters are unique and hysterical - with a fantastic story to boot! It has a "Pulp Fiction" type appeal with an even better story "intersection". Be forewarned, this is a dialogue driven movie and only for those able to listen closely through the British accents.

Review title: Hilarious. Perfect style, amazing characters, good violence.
Review_body: This movie was absolutely hilarious.  I have watched it many times and am still not sick of it.  The characters, the camerawork, and the story make this movie worth seeing.  It is violent, and vulgar, but it is top notch (and very humorous) violence and vulgarity.  Profanity usually turns me off, but in this movie I laugh every time they tell each other to f--- off. Maybe it's the accent.  Ok yes it is the accent.  This movie was pulled off with perfect style.  I recommend it to everybody with a reasonably high tolerance for blood and the F word.  If you watch it, try to see past such trivialities.

Review title: Brad Pitt at his ugliest = Brad Pitt at his best.
Review_body: This film was a real shocker for me . . . faster and funnier than I ever expected. Be forewarned not to watch it with youngsters (violence and language) and don't watch it when you're really tired - you won't be able to keep up with the action! This is the best I've seen in a long time.

This is my absolute favorite movie of all time.  The character development is masterful.  The music and cinematography are first rate.  Guy Ritchie creates a plot thats exciting and keeps you guessing whats next.  Alan Ford is hilarious and Dennis Farina is the real American-- "Don't go to London."

It's pretty rare that you see a movie like SNATCH.  This movie hits its audience with action and just about anything else it can think of to throw. Every character is larger than life, and each performance is amazing. With characters like Bullet-Tooth Tony, Boris (the Blade), Freddy Four Fingers, and the unintelligible Mickey, this movie is definitely worth a viewing (or 10).

Turkish (Jason Stathem) is a struggling boxing promoter who just wants to earn a living promoting boxing. He and his wanna be tough friend, Tommy (Stephan Graham), find out the hard way that certain people should not be dealt with if you want to stay out of trouble. Two of the people they find out who shouldn't be messed with is, One Punch Mickey O'Neil (Brad Pitt), and one boxing promoter/ Kingpin, Brick Top (Alan Ford). Turkish and Tommy end up dealing with these two characters and realize that there is so much more to them then meets the eye. Mean while there is a huge diamond that has been stolen and every gangster and mob man wants it. This adds a whole big twist in lives of not only local gangsters and mob men, but also local jewelers and thieves. While Turkish and Tommy end up trying to deal with their new "friends", the whole rest of the gangster community fights over the diamond. Though out the whole movie the diamond changes hands and in the end, it ends up with the most unlikely character.This movie had great potential and came through. It was a great action comedy that kept me glued to the screen. It had everything from Fights to Shootings, to people getting limbs chopped off. Great, I know. The comedy that went with it was something that of a man getting hit in the privates. You know you shouldn't laugh but it was so hard not to. It was mostly dark humor, dealing with death and violence so you kind of feel bad for laughing but they set it up in a way were it worked.The British dialect was a bit hard to follow at the beginning, but after a while you get used to it. It was definitely one of those movies that you would have to watch again just so you could catch every thing that was said. The hardest character to understand would have to be Brad Pitts. They do this on purpose because he is supposed to be a non-educated gypsy that no one can understand, but again as the movie digresses you start to learn the dialect and get to love his character.This movie had lots and lots of characters, but seemed to keep them under control. It reminded me of the movie "smoking aces", in the fact that there were many characters. Almost too many in the beginning but the movie did a great job of either killing them off, or just kind of pushing them aside and you forgetting about them. It also jumped around a lot. They would go from character to character and not give a lead to the scene change. I some what enjoyed this part of the movie but others could very easily get lost.The narrating part done by Jason Stathem really did add something to the movie. He has played in other movies were he has played the bad ass that beats everyone up. In this role he really does show that he can actually act. I am a big fan of the starting a movie at the end of a movie and the narrator going back trough and telling you how they got to were they were. I think when directors do this they always have a great way to end the movie. In this movie they definitely pulled it off.So I would have to say you would really enjoy this movie if you don't mind the dark humor with violence. If you love stories were there really is no really clear cut good guy. It doesn't end like you thought it would and tons of big guns and people getting what they deserve, you should definitely "Snatch" up this movie.

i thought this film was great. it kept you interested for the whole time. not for anyone who doesnt like violence but anyone else is fine.i would recommend this to you so if you havent seen it go see it now!

Review title: A well written and well played out movie,
Review_body: i went to see the movie because i am a fan of guy and brad. it was so well written and played out i could not see how the actors in the movie had not been in the spotlight from the first viewing of the movie. if you are a fan of movies with twists and turns it's the movie for you from the intro to the finish, you sit and marvel at the storyline and characters, i could go no forever. so i leave you with this, watch the movie.

somebody said.. not a date rental movie..i beg to differ... watched it on my first date n forgot all about the date got caught up in the movie...!! i have watched it over n over again ever since... i guess part of the reason why i liked the movie was its a complex mixture of detached black humor.. black humor that is over the top and is supported by an equally over the top performances.. just when you thought you were done with double-takes... more double-takes come crashing by..bullet tooth tony... i am even scared to say anything lest he should materialize from somewhere with his well crafted caustic remarks. for want of a better word all i can say awesome.

Review title: Put All The Good Things From Lock Stock Altogether, Then Adds Some More
Review_body: After watching lock stock and two smoking barrels and then snatch it feels like completely different. Unlike its predecessor this ones a bit more funny but also more serious. Still i want to highlight a view things in my review regarding my first watch of the movie (with several pausing and rewind of course); So far I'm still thinking how the hell this Guy Ritchie's mind function. I mean where does he start writing the story from. Its just so brilliant that i still think this is the best crime comedy ever. Though Del Tor0 only plays big in the beginning and i kind of disappointed in that, i think Pitt has done really well, so is all other actors with big role in this movie and even Del Tor0 himself. Most of the words spoken make me laugh all the way through the movie. Its just seem unbelievable the writing is.Anyway, check this bottom one out.Apart from all its positivity i found this movie quite confusing not for the subtitles i was using or anything but for the lack of its writing. Apparently i found myself confused with day and night as the notorious brick top state there will be another rematch for mickey in the next couple of days. but that happens only the next day. The part involving Vinnie, Sol and Tyrone though, is somehow slow. Picture this, somebody just got killed in your house, whom in this movie is the whatever four fingers guy Del Toro play, then you wait for the next day to move the guy from your guest room, which isn't even locked in the noontime. It makes a lot more sense if this Boris the blade guy see them in the afternoon, rather than night as is shown. And as for himself, i found himself quite flashing as he returned home after got hit by a car then in an instant return to the pub which is perhaps a block away while Bullet Tooth Tony just got away from the telephone. I mean, look at this, his car meets with Jason Stat's car somewhere on the road but when Jason reach Boris building he returned ON FOOT with a speed as striking as the light. Haven't yet spell that Jason's car was facing the wrong direction.Apart from the brilliant opening scene which stun me in front of the screen (i was planning to just test whether the video recorder worked) for the rest of the time, the ending is somewhat flawed, i mean what do the two black guys waiting for to bury those corpses in the noon light. Though i must say i forbid Ritchie as even the last scene when Jason Stat car pass by their place and the dog looking from the LEFT window is angularly correct, and so is the map of the location that i picture during the view. Still i think it lacks on the writing as it needs to be revised. But out of all the editing, directing and all is formidable, overall this is a pretty enjoyable movie as it is funny and seriously great, of course the twists brilliant too.

Having seen Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels by the same writer/director, Guy Ritchie, and loved it, I very much looked forward to seeing this film.  While the story was different, the over all pacing, confrontations, and plot twists were very much the same.  It was if I had already seen it before.  Worth seeing nonetheless, especially if you haven't seen Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels.

Review title: What do unlicensed boxing promoters, pig-feeding gangsters, diamond thieves, unkillable ex-KGB operatives, gypsies, and shady pawnbrokers have in common?
Review_body: The answer to this riddle is found in about two hours of the most brilliantly comical moviemaking since.....well, actually, I can't think of anything at the moment that compares.The trailers for this movie never got me interested enough to actually get off my duff and get to the theater to see it on the big screen.  The downside is that I almost missed seeing one of the funniest movies I have ever seen in my life.  The upside is that when my wife rented it on a whim, we could pause it when we were laughing so hard we could hardly breathe.  We ended up buying it on VHS and then again when we got DVD...and we simply don't buy movies.  Ain't generally worth it...but this one is.That said, Snatch isn't for everybody.  For one thing, there's enough coarse language to crisp the ears of any easily offended person who gets within hearing distance.  It's also very fast paced, laced with a patchwork of dialects and accents that aren't always easy to understand (which is kinda the point, actually), and requires the audience to actually pay attention.  It's this last requirement that loses the most fans, I would guess, given the ridiculous popularity of mindless drivel starring "actors" like friggin' Britney Spears, fer cryin'  out loud.Suffice it to say that if you appreciate irony, cynical humor, black comedy, and well written, well acted character drama more than special effects, gimmicks, gratuitous nudity (not that I'm knocking gratuitous nudity), stupid stunts and all the other pap Hollywood is cookie-cutter stamping out these days, then you'll love Snatch. Otherwise, go watch just about anything Brian De Palma ever put out.

this is the best film I've ever seen i watch it at least once a month every month. it was the first Guy Ritchie film i saw and since then i have been watching every movie he has ever made. this movie is not only funny but action packed and full of twist and turns. this movie has action, some violence, strong language and great characters all the makings for a great movie and it is the best i have ever seen. Brad Pitt plays a bad ass character as mickey he does some great boxing scenes. boxing the only true man sport. Also Vinnie Jones is excellent, along With Dennis Farina and Jason Statham are the big name actors but every one plays great roles.recommended for everyone.

Snatch is are very good and funny movie directed by guy Ritchie.In the beginning of the movie we see guys dressed like Jew's in the lift,they are doing conversation about a bible, when the conversation ends,the lift reaches right floor and all Jew's are going to rob a building where are diamonds.This movie style is different than other's.Movie contains a slow motion effects,good jazz-style soundtrack and good funny action.Of course the movie have a very funny characters(like Mickey,Tyrone,Tommy,Franky four fingers and others).But in this movie you will see only few female characters.That makes me very sad,but by the way there super-funny dialog's that makes this movie amazing.If you want to spend a good time in the evening you must watch this movie,because this movie is the one of best movies ever made

Review title: So good I could see it over and over again

The attitude, the gestures, the way he talks, the way he moves, fights, drinks, even smells is just like but from real life and put on the screen. The story, the characters, the pace, the sounds, the image makes out of this comedy movie a real masterpiece of the genre. Also, the other actors contribution is complementing the movie so well it is impossible not to follow it till the last second of it. The cast is outstanding packed with heavy names and they all give out the best for this story. There's no need to say more. I am giving it top score cause it couldn't have been done better.Peace, Love and Godspeed.

Snatch by Guy Ritchie is a wonderful comedy, and a marked improvement in his directing and sense of humor since Lock Stock (Though that is not saying that Lock Stock is bad - the contrary would be correct.The characters are created with an astoundingly sharp sense of humor, wit and cleverness, and the casting is absolutely perfect. Brad Pitt as the pikey is amazing, and Alan Ford does a perfect job of Brick Top. Vinnie Jones fits snugly into Tony's shoes, and Dennis Farina, forever the Jewish/Italian ruthless dude (see Get Shorty).The plot, it goes without saying, is woven with fine articulateness by Ritchie, and the acting is superb. Although not a movie fitting for oscar winners for the best film, the actors certainly are from the top of the class - have a look at Franky (Benicio Del Toro), Mickey (Brad Pitt), Avi (Dennis Farina), Doug (Mike Reid), and Tony (Vinnie Jones).A great performance. top marks

Well acted, well directed and well written. Snatch entertains the viewer from beginning to end with a storyline that twists and turns, humour and plenty of action. A strong cast including Brad Pitt, Jason Statham and Vinnie Jones are all prominent and give strong performances. While Statham and Jones basically play the same character in this film and others like it (Lock Stock) Pitt shows his acting range by excellently portraying an Irish traveller. As an Irish person myself I felt the accent was a small bit off but it was certainly a very good attempt. Of course, this accent would have been difficult to perfect for any actor but Pitt makes an excellent stab at it and his mannerisms are spot on.The in-your-face nature of this film is appealing and its quick paced scenes and dialogue keep the viewer interested from start to finish. Confrontations between the Irish travellers and the English gangsters are funny and well written as are the escapades of the three amateur criminals Vinny, Sol and Tyrone and their dog.Overall the film is well produced and the exciting plot keeps you guessing until the end. 8/10

A well done film with a cunning story line. With Benicio Del Toro only having a minor role, you know it's going to be a good movie. Brad Pitt has an excellent role with a hard to understand Pikey accent that would've been even harder to perform. The reason it's my favourite movie is the fact that it has multiple story lines that unite, like Pulp Fiction and humour that isn't cheesy but still makes you laugh. I'm continuously laughing but also intrigued as to what will happen next. With characters like Tyrone, Vinny, bullet tooth Tony and Tommy the laughs don;t stop. The swearing isn't over done and is used specifically for laughs and thats what makes it work. Snatch is currently my favourite movie and I don't see it changing anytime soon.

Cheeky short but sweet review.During a day of intense and resilient boredom I watched Snatch and Fight Club for the first time. Needless to say I had a pretty great day, and these two films immediately made it into my top 5.Exposing the hilarious nature of your everyday thugs and thieves is one of Guy Ritche's directing traits it seems, and this greatly unique screenplay and classic twisted comedy is something only he is capable of.As well as being (undeniably) one of Brad Pitt's Career highlights, this film uses clever narrative/ visual styles mixed with perfect casting and a more perfect soundtrack to form a gritty, unpretentious picture. Buy it, steal it, stream it, just do it now.

Review title: One of the best, if not the best, movie of it's genre. (No spoilers)
Review_body: This is truly an excellent movie. I just finished reading all of the 1 and 2 star reviews and I have something to say. Most of the people who reviewed this movie whined and complained mainly about the genre of the movie, and not the movie itself. Snatch is a smart and funny crime action movie. IF YOU DO NOT LIKE CRIME ACTION MOVIES, YOU WILL NOT LIKE THIS MOVIE. However, if you do like movies in this genre, you will love this movie. It may be the best movie in this genre I have ever seen.It is plainly a Tarantino influenced movie, and not as good as a Tarantino flick, but it is still very good. People call this a rip off, and boring. I cannot understand that point of view. Who falls asleep during snatch? I love the characters, the speed of the movie, and the humor. I basically just wanted to counteract one of the 1 star reviews with my 10/10 review. Those idiots just hate this movie because of the genre. I don't like emotional, boring movies, so I don't watch the Piano, or the Notebook and movies I know I won't enjoy. Some people seem to watch movies they know they will hate, and then write terrible reviews. One of the best, if not the best, movie of it's genre.

Review title: Everything I look for in a movie
Review_body: Snatch is without a doubt one of my favorite movies of all time, actually I cannot come up with another title that tops this one. It's got everything i look for in a movie: humor, action, great atmosphere, super kewl characters (Turkish, Mickey, Boris the Bullet dodger, Bullet tooth Tony, Tyrone!!!), superb soundtrack, a good storyline, very original and inventive filming-techniques, lot's of great one liners. And it's a movie you can watch over and over again. Something I can't say about another very kewl Guy Richie flick; Lock Stock and two smoking barrels.favorite quote: "I thought you said he was a getaway driver, what can he get away from?"I highly recommend this movie and I give it a 9.2/10 score. (#1 on my personal list, but you never know what the future brings us)

I watched this when the movie came out and loved it. It is now showing on FLIX television. I watch it every time it comes on...and it just keeps getting better.The angles and dialog are perfect! Hysterical is not the right word for this movie.....maybe convulsive. The actors are wonderful - each and every one of them. Guy hit the ball out of the park with this one!!!

Guy Ritchie delivers once again with a funny, thrilling, gangster film the way they are meant to be done. Jason Statham as 'Turkish', the unlicensed boxing promoter who gets pulled in over his head by the ruthless Brick Top (Alan Ford, an excellent performance), is brilliant. Vinnie Jones is also perfect as Bullet Tooth Tony in his interactions with the bumbling diamond heist in which it seems he is the only competent figure. I was a little disappointed by Brad Pitt though and would prefer in future if Ritchie would stick to the more authentic cast of Brit gangsters he normally uses who can at least get the accent right. All in all still a brilliant film and a must see for any Ritchie fan or otherwise.

This was an amazing movie. The dialogue was extremely witty and tied in with the acting perfectly. There is an element of hilarity which will also appeal to a lot of people. Not a single actor in this movie was bad, each person played their role perfectly. The different cultures were portrayed perfectly and the acting reflects on that. Another really cool aspect of the movie were the wonderfully colorful names that each character gets. They alone contribute to the culture.It's amazing how the entire movie revolves around one pivotal moment in the beginning but then branches out into the matrix of stories that are all entwined and then brought back together in the end.This is the epitome of a good movie, great acting, great actors, great story, great culture, great dialogue. "Snatch" has it all.

This is the best British movie i have ever seen and is personally my favourite movie. This is guy Richie's second film, the first being lock stock and two smoking barrels which i was also very keen on.snatch is a great comedy movie that delivers plenty of action and a witty plot and cast of characters helps make this movie even better.the cast includes Jason statham, Vinnie Jones and even brad Pitt. Turkish (statham) is a small time illegal boxing promoter but when the bare-knuckle boxing champion, mickey, knocks out Turkish's star fighter, gorgeous George, Turkish's life completely changes. he has to come up with a replacement fighter who would satisfy his ruthless gangster boss. but whilst he is trying to stay alive, a character called Franky four fingers has stole a diamond the size of a fist.Guy Richie cleverly delivers a great twist of plots, leaving the audience glued to their seats. this is a great gangster comedy that should not be missed. 10/10
