Snatch is a Top Shelf movie. If you're a fan of Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, then this movie is for you. Its got V.O.C. (Variety, Originality and Creativity). It dominates within its genre and takes pages from others. The characters have great depth in personality and are easy to fall for. The story is original, but for this day and age, the shock value lacks a bit, but is made up for through its original comedy, action, random dialog (including pi key language) and the twisty plot. SNATCH IS my favorite movie, you can tell by my email address. On a side note, this movie is one I can say none of my friends would ever enjoy if watching it with me. I kid you not when I say I've memorized every line and accent of this movie. Watch it, because there's nothing anyone, including me, can say to convince you how well this movie was made.

Review title: A movie to be re watched
Review_body: This movie is amazing, all the actors fit well in it. The story is really funny and have its own twists, as you would expect from a Guy Ritchie movie. Much like it's predecessor, Lock, Stock and Two Smoking Barrels, it has a few story lines that will connect in the end for a great ending and with a few actors from the previous movies as well. Jason Statham is great as the Turkish, Brad Pitt is really funny, and Brick Top is a great villain, great job done by Alan Ford.One of my favorite movies of all time, I never get bored watching it again and again.I highly recommend to watch this movie. Best movie from Guy Ritchie

After discussing Quentin Tarantino and Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels, this movie was recommended to me, and it is fantastic. Any fan of dialog driven movies and black humor will view this film as a gem. The movie follows a boxing promoter and his accomplice along with three petty thieves trying to recover a large diamond for their "employers" for lack of a better word. This movie doesn't include plot twists, but as I watched it I thought to myself on several occasions, "I didn't see that coming." Among the unexpected turns, the film's cast compliments the quirkiness. Jason Statham and Vinnie Jones steal every scene they're in. The only problem I had with the movie was not understanding some of the dialog because of the characters' thick accents, but I still understood it. However, take all its good qualities,top it off with a sleazy Brad Pitt and that one dude from Scarface, and you have a thrilling, gritty, silly, and stylistic caper.

Regarded by many to be writer and director Guy Ritchie's magnum opus; Snatch serves as the follow-up to his smash-hit, cult-classic, feature-length debut Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels with more of the same. The film is an all-encompassing showreel of what makes a Guy Ritchie film, a Guy Ritchie film, with its kinetic directing and editing styles, witty and sharp dialogue, gratuitous violence, and ensemble cast of interconnected characters. You can't help but feel watching Ritchie's films, Snatch especially, that he was perhaps too inspired by the works of Quentin Tarantino, and his own attempt to recapture Pulp Fiction in a British setting falls a bit flat. As seems to be a recurring theme of Ritchie's films, the audience and critic perceptions are practically polar opposites, and I can understand why. While I think Snatch has some absolutely outstanding elements, including fantastic and memorable characters and performances, as well as being infinitely quotable and rewatchable, I do think its components are more powerful than the sum of its parts. While the film is far from perfect, it does succeed in achieving what it set out to do. A rollicking good time with plenty of thrills and laughs, that I can already see myself wanting to revisit.

I honestly never really cared of Guy Richie and had no intention of ever trying to see anything he did, I mean the guy's married to Maddona.Snatch is one of those rare movies that you can easily pick up and watch over and over again. Not since Pulp Fiction have I ever been able to watch a movie and laugh at the jokes Every time I watch it. Yes, for those of you who haven't seen it, Snatch is very funny. Filled with very memorable characters, very creative direction and editing and top notch performances from everyone involved, Snatch is very easy to recommend and is a riot when watching it with friends (Who have very dark tastes.) Go and watch this movie today if possible 10 out of 10.

Review title: One of the greatest movies for me
Review_body: Snatch is a movie from the year 2000 directed and written by Guy Richie. The movie is about Irish gangsters, hit men,jewel thieves, and a gypsy boxer. Some of the stars in the film are Jason Statham as Turkish, Brad Pitt as Mickey, Alan Ford as Brick Top, and Benicio Del Toro as Franky Four Fingers. Turkish and his sidekick Tommy get themselves into many altercations with their gangster boss Brick Top. One of the most interesting altercations is when they get involved with a bare knuckle boxer by the name of Mickey. The movie follows their attempts to survive as earned boys. The theme of this movie is survival in the underground world. Turkish and Tommy make many mistakes in this movie which pushes them further and further into the underground life. I really enjoy how the director lightens the mood of these mistakes with humor. Turkish and Tommy have exceptional chemistry when it comes to disagreeing or making fun of each other. This chemistry is what kept me so involved in the movie. While there is plenty of comedy the two also display plenty of serious when death is involved. The music in the film adds depth and increases the overall entertainment value. There are plenty of scenes that would have been good without the music, but when then music is added the scene becomes breath taking. In the beginning of the movie where Mickey challenges Gorgeous George to a bare knuckle fight is a good example of this. Without the music the scene would have been just like any other bare knuckle fight scene. With the addition of music and slow motion the scene comes to life.Another great aspect of this movie is how it had multiple plots but still maintained to satisfy your interests with each of them. You would think that one or two plots would be hard enough to properly portray. Snatch properly portrays at least 5. Following the diamond, an unlicensed boxing promoters, a bare knuckle boxer, an Irish gangster, and a confused timid sidekick is not a easy task. Guy Ritchie does an exceptional job of explaining each in great detail in 104 minutes.Snatch is one of my favorite movies of all times. I really enjoy knowing that I only knew one actor in this movie. I did not know the director or the writer or any other actors for this matter. This movie has an completely unbiased review from me. Yet it remains to be in my top 5 all time list of greatest movies.

Review title: One of my go to favorites
Review_body: I can't believe any bad reviews. All time best script, directing and film editing. Wow. How can anyone watch this film and then say Guy Ritchie can't direct.

This movie is COOL.From the beginning until the end it's cool.It has all that i like and i want to watch on a movie.Ritchie did a great job.A lot of characters,a fast plot that it won't make you bored,clever lines,cool jokes,gangsters,boxers,thieves.The entire movie has the cool element in it.Tarantino is a big influence to Ritchie and that's visible so if you like Tarantino's work you will like and that movie.It has a "Pulp Fiction" mood but in the British way and style.The cast is great(some actors played and in "lock,stock"),Ritchie did some very good choices.Just if you look at the cover you will understand that these guys are not joking. Jones,the baddest guy on earth,is the right man to play "Bullet Tooth Tony".He convinces you only with a look. Statham as "Turkish" is the man,with this "i don't care about nothing" face. Pitt plays "Mickey" a gypsy boxer,very good performance.Nothing less than you except.A great movie to watch.10/10

Review title: best movie I have seen in a long time
Review_body: Wow! Thats basically all I would need to say to describe the film. Guy Ritchie was brilliant to come out with that kind of scenario and the execution was great with good actors (Brad Pitt, Vinnie Jones....). It is not the newest movie but certainly stays in my gold fond for a long time. I cant say that this is the best movie i have seen but competes in no doubt with the best. All the way long the movie kept going and there were not a single moment when I would of thought of taking a leak or making my self a sandwich. In one word my thoughts were all the time in Snatch. Usually the big errors in the execution catch my eye but in a moment i cant remember any that would of had disturbed me. OK i guess i have to see it again then.

Review title: One of the best movies i have ever seen
Review_body: it has comedy ,crime , action and mix them together perfectly.the names of the characters in this film is awesome (Boris the Blade, Gorgeous George or Doug the Head etc..)Brad Pitt's character is have awesome talking style.the story is film motors like a car driven by a chatty maniac who somehow stays on the road.the director may be skilled at generating controlled chaos, but his surprise-a-minute strategy ultimately holds no surprises.also snatch have a good soundtrack album.Snatch is hard to figure out, but even harder not to laugh at.

Review title: Favorite Brad Pitt Performance of All-Time
Review_body: Mickey (Brad Pitt) speaks totally gibberish with such charm, body languages and facial expression that there is not doubt what he is saying.. He appears to be having a great time performing it too. So relaxed.

Review title: One of the best Caper films ever!!
Review_body: I am a graduate of the director admirers theory in life. You like a few films the director does and you should find something redeeming in most of their works. I cannot even say I will watch a film for the actors alone. Like when I watched this film, I was more interested in the director than Brad Pitt being in it and I count myself as a Pitt fan (Seven, Fight Club, the first Ocean's Eleven). I wanted to see what this director could do (I had never seen his work), I had heard from my male friends that it was great but I form my opinions myself. It was to be a surprise and it turned out that it wasn't in the video collection so they went out and bought a copy at the local video store. Yes, Virginia, it is that good if you don't have a copy to show, you go out and buy another. So we settled in to watch the mystery movie. I have to say that through out the whole thing, it wasn't the story that got me so much as the angles. The cinematography was AWESOME. There were scenes that you would NEVER see regular directors trying. It was so beautiful. The story, let me get back to that, was fast-paced and frenetic. It was cunning and articulate. In the end, or near to it (I hope y'all know what moment I mean) I clapped!! I cared for the characters in a way that hasn't capture my emotions for a long time, maybe that is just the girl in me talking though.... Its a good solid energetic film with the best cinematography I have seen in so many years. I highly recommend it and if you can't get your girlfriend to watch it--mention the scene with Pitt in his underwear and she should watch it readily!! (I had no such warning--whoo!)
One of the best English films. Fantastic writing and the direction is unreal.Start to finish. Tense with comedy

This movie was a lot of fun. There was never a dull moment. Every
scene had a reason and an effect on the plot. There were no fluff
scenes used just to fill the movie. The actors were all very wonderful.
Kudos to Brad Pitt and Jason Statham for doing a superb job with their
characters. If you want an action packed movie with lots of humor,
this is the movie for you. Guy Richie, keep those movie's coming!
So funny and just such a good movie.It's a must watch 👍

Review title: fantastic guy Ritchie has made yet another superb film
Review_body: After lock, stock Guy Ritchie certainly had a tough act to follow! but with its mixture of comedy, action and a fantastic storyline he has certainly done it! snatch is a gangster film with a diamond heist, illegal boxing and a professional killer this film has enough action to keep you on the edge of your seat while making you laugh with its hilariously original comedy! with a brilliant twist at the end this film will keep you guessing until the end! If you enjoyed lock, stock and two smoking barrels then you cannot afford to miss this film! brilliant film an instant classic! must see for any film fanatic or anybody for that matter!

Why? Just why? I would have serious concern for the state of mental health of anyone that enjoyed this film. Even writing a few statements in review is a waste of time.
Totally insipid trash - with some interesting editing.

Review title: Do not miss out on this good time.
Review_body: Turkish (Jason Statham), Tommy (Stephen Graham), Brick Top (Alan Ford), Bullet Tooth Tony (Vinnie Jones), Boris The Blade (Rade Serbedzija), Sol (Lennie James), Vinny (Robbie Gee), Tyrone (Ade), Gorgeous George (Adam Fogerty), Frankie Four Fingers (Benicio del Toro), Cousin Avi Denovitz and the list goes on. If that gaggle of unique character names and cast members does not spark your movie watching interest I don't know what will. These characters are just part of the many great elements that make up the movie "Snatch"; which landed the 100th spot on the "IMDb top 250" movies list.With a plot focused theme, this comedy/thriller takes us on an outing full of hilarious mischief, and it plays off the popular saying "trust no one". Fast paced and full of plot twist, we watch the main character Turkish become involuntarily involved in troublesome predicaments. Turkish and Tommy have their hands full trying to pay off a debt owed to the gangster Brick Top due to a boxing bet gone bad, because Mickey (their unruly prize fighter) not being able to follow directions. At the same time, we have the feud between Boris and Cousin Avi Denovtiz over a diamond heist performed by Frankie Four Fingers whom worked for Avi and was set up to be robbed by Boris. Boris the Blade's reputation for violence requires Avi to hire the hit-man Bullet Tooth Tony to help him retrieve his stolen diamond. Although Avi hired an able body to complete his task, Boris was not so fortunate when he hired the incapable Sol, Vinny and Tyrone to steal the stone from Frankie Four Fingers, and rob the bookies owned by the gangster Brick Top. Brick Top in turn puts on a search to find the 3 who attempted to rob his establishment, and they in turn give Brick Top knowledge of the diamond which he sends them to retrieve to avoid death. Whew! That's a lot going on. So, after many bullets fly, and hysterical interactions take place the movie comes full circle, and we end with the main character/narrator Turkish on top with the diamond, alongside his friend Tommy. "Snatch" is riddled with jump-cuts, witty fast paced dialogue, and subjective camera angles that help the audience stay interested, and feel like part of the film. Every scene plays into the plot, and any unneeded story/scenes are left out of the film. So, it is important for viewers to be attentive while watching the film or you will be sure to miss amusing conversations, and key moments. The angles help you engage in the conversation as they seem to be in first person view and the cut back and forth between the characters. Guy Richie used the same style and plot driven theme in his other film "Locked, Stocked, and Two Smoking Barrels". We also see some of the same actors such as Jason Statham and Vinnie Jones in this film too, but it was missing Brad Pitt who puts on a noteworthy performance as Mickey in "Snatch". Though quite comical Snatch is most certainly an adult film. Although some parts of the movie can be considered grisly, it still manages to put a funny spin on murder, and deception (I know that sounds a little crazy). Between a botched robbery, which included a getaway driver who can barely fit in his own car, Brick Top's passion for pigs, and Bullet Tooth Tony's different but effective way of handling his victims, you will get a fair share of laughing at illegal activities.If you are a person who loves movies that are plot driven, fast paced, and packed with charismatic dialogue be sure to watch "Snatch" when you get a chance. This movie will not disappoint.

Review title: Hate it or LOVE IT...No Inbetweensies!
Review_body: Humoristic, action packed & with a great storyline. UK's finest meet US' best actors, each one carefully handpicked to perfection to play out their role in contributung to guarantee the authenticity of the twisted story and what you might expect of their character in this low budget-Guy Richie at his best-Masterpiece Movie. A Must See!

Snatch is not a classic or a block buster movie.But still it is considered as one of the best gangster franchise movies.This movie is directed by Guy Ritchie. Guy Richie is known for his non linear movie editing style as the scenes will not be a sequence but it will be shifting back and forth.This movie is part of his franchise gangster movie called as Rock n rolla,lock stock and barrels.What I Liked in this movie is its narrative style and his engaging dialogues like in martin Scorsese movie.This movie has lot of thumping scenes where we rouse to clap our hands due to its dialogue. Inspite of having complex characterization and scenes in the movie,audience is not confused and they ought to enjoy this movie.Obviously the movie is gross in few scenes one reason being a gangster subject and another one being a gangster movie.I am sure that gangster movie fans will like and love this movie!!!!!

Review title: Very South East London gangster reality!
Review_body: Following Lock Stock and Two Smoking Barrels would have been no easy task without the input of Brad Pitt. However he obviously saw the potential of this film and, I believe, offered his services for next to nothing. Having said that it was an enormous risk to star an American actor in the role of such a strangely particular person as "The Pikey" and I am so impressed with Richie's bravery and Pitt's abilities. The editing of the film is such an incredibly cohesive representation of the reality it seeks to portray. The violent and comically black survival humor it depicts, along with the adrenaline rush of street lunacy it encompasses was and is about as accurate as you can get. Life as it is for those who want to be upwardly mobile at the hard end of London. What's more I am a Pikey!The only caveat would be, subtitles for the rest of the Planet.

Review title: snatch is the coolest movie of this generation
Review_body: I thought this movie was really entertaining . It really kept me interested the whole time . It was packed with loads of action , and also had some laugh out load humor . Brad Pitt once again stole the screen as a Irish fast talking gypsy . He did an amazing job . Snatch is one of the coolest movies of this generation . It was also a very comical movie . The whole plot of the story really grabs your attention from the get go . I loved the action and I loved the realistic feel of the movie , it wasn't some fake movie it made me feel like it was real life . This movie will keep you entertained throughout the whole thing and will make you laugh .Tava

Review title: Crime comedy from a fresh perspective
Review_body: I must first admit that I've seen this film close to 20 times. I never get tired of seeing it (I'm starting to understand pikey!!). The characters are memorable, the script un-Hollywood, the humour sharp, and the directorial genius of Guy Ritchie is evident. There are slow motion shots, split-screens, and all kinds of other orthodox film-making techniques. These, together with beautifully written dialogues, great performances (Especially Del Toro, Farina, Ford, Pitt, Graham....I could go on forever), and the great integration of different story lines come together to make one helluva flick. Well done Mr Ritchie (or is that Mr Madonna??? heck, I'll just call you Susan if you want!) Having seen both Lock, stock....and Snatch, I'd say snatch just takes it at the finish, literally.

A positively brilliant film. I loved it possibly my favourite film along side of lock stock also written and directed by guy Ritchie. I love this film about how the plot forms it has a great narrative. I love how it is typical to the form of genre that it is associated to. You will be in watching this all the way though and laughing it is great. Btw is you loved this you got to watch lock stock as well. It has great film form and the generic conventions are tied in brilliantly into the film. It creates a real sense of expectation from the narrative as you are driven though the story. It is stylishly shot with great angles which give the real effect of the film. It has a typical grimy look to it just like London it is typical of British cinema. I can watch this film over and over and every time I notice something new within the mise-en-sense of the film. Who ever said gangster films are dead they lied.

Review title: Fantastic plot pieces brilliantly put together made this movie even better than pulp fiction
Review_body: Man, this is one from the category "I couldn't stop watching it over and over..." If you liked Pulp fiction, you're gonna simply worship this movie. Not only that it provides constant fun and excitement throughout the entire movie but it also provides you with such memorable characters that you'll never forget. Starting from Turkish, leading to Brickface and so on... Mixture of different, sometimes laughable and amusing, sometimes of unexpectedly cruel nature, sometimes both of this, time & space scenes, fantastically put together so that your eye won't look to another direction for not even a second of this film. To all of you who enjoy a good action full of unexpected events and turnouts this is a must-see. O yeah, if you remembered Guy Ritchie as "the English bloke who married Madonna", after you see this movie you' re gonna ask yourself: "What's the name of that pop singer married to Guy Ritchie?"

Snatch is a glimpse into the dark mind of Guy Ritchie, a man who has continuously created seemingly dark films, from Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels to King Arthur: Legend of the Sword. Snatch has the same feel as Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels, which shows us that his love for intricate plots, wry wit, and dingy settings is never ending. With Snatch, Guy Ritchie brings angsty violence to a new level, as if Jeffrey Dahmer and David Fincher got together for coffee (or perhaps tea) in the criminal underworld of Britain.The film weaves two stories together, that of a hunt for an 84-carat diamond and an unlicensed boxing match. The diamond is stolen in Antwerp by Franky Four Fingers (Benicio Del Toro) to give to Cousin Avi (Dennis Farina) back in New York City. Franky is a relaxed heistman and Avi is, simply put, a precursor to the rough-around-the-edges J.K. Simmons in Spiderman. Once in possession of the diamond, Franky naively takes advice from two men, a robber who recommends Franky visit Boris the Blade (Rade Serbedzija) for weapons and Avi who sends Franky to Doug the Head (Mike Reid) for a proper appraisal. Boris, an ex-KGB agent, sends Franky to the bookies on his behalf in exchange for a gun, and proceeds to send a trio of inexperienced crooks to rob the same bookies.We then find Turkish, a disgruntled Jason Statham, and his partner Tommy, an innocent Stephen Graham, sitting in a dimly lit room. Turkish is a small-time boxing promoter who soon finds himself in need of a caravan to develop his business. Turkish and Tommy travel to a group of "pikies," irish travellers and speakers of a English-Irish hybrid language that you will need captioning to understand. Mickey (Brad Pitt), the leader, asks them if they like "dags," sells them a hunk of junk, punches out their prized boxer, and agrees to work as their new boxer in the meantime.Brick Top (Alan Ford), the gangster coordinator of the unlicensed boxing match, practically owns Turkish and Tommy, in addition to hundreds of pigs he keeps in his basement. He is the disgusting and crude puppetmaster who punishes the weak and disloyal, and who controls everyone else in the story to do his bidding. Mickey continues to fight in Brick Top's boxing matches, and the diamond moves from person to person, reaching practically every character in this tangled web of filth.The film continues from there, with most characters crossing stories, and reaches complete equilibrium during one iconic scene. We see Turkish and Tommy in one car, debating the morality of Turkish drinking milk. In another car are the three inexperienced robbers, Sol (Lennie James), Vinny (Robbie Gee), and Tyrone (Ade). The third car contains Cousin Avi, his bodyguard, and "bullet-tooth" Tony (Vinnie Jones), who Avi hired based on his refusal of death. Oh, and Boris is in the trunk of their car. Tommy throws Turkish's milk out the window and it lands on the third car with Avi, his bodyguard, and Tony inside, who crash into a pole. Boris, with a sack over his head, jumps out of the trunk and is hit by the second car, driven by Tyrone. This is truly where Ritchie brings the story together in a way that actually makes sense.Aside from this one thoughtfully planned scene, Ritchie tightens the loose-fitting plot with music by John Murphy. He distinguishes the serious moments from the comic ones through the background music. In the opening credits, we hear generic bad punk rock as bright colors and spinning images mirror the music, matching the ever gaudy 90s-style of Lola Rennt. When we meet Brick Top, an ominous and Godfather-esque track plays to show us he truly is the top dog. Ritchie makes it so, when we say "oh shoot" to ourselves while watching, the music determines whether it's said with a smile or with wide eyes.He also uses dry humor to make chopping up a body seem like chopping vegetables, and this humor makes the religious and nationality jokes easier to swallow. The humor is in the dialogue and the cinematography. Ritchie employs quick jokes such as when Boris the Blade says,"Heavy is good. Heavy is reliable. If it doesn't work you can always hit them with it," referring to a gun he is selling. Ritchie also uses quick camera cuts, jumping from one character to another as he did in the triple-car scene, to make the scene that much funnier. These are staples in european comedy films and this is truly where the comedy lies, in dry and fast humor with dry and fast camera cuts. For those of us not generally accustomed to British humor, it will take at least a few viewings to understand the jokes, and even more to understand the plot.Ritchie created a darkly comical film with a complicated plot, a film that is identical in formula to its predecessor, Lock, Stock, and Two Smoking Barrels. Where Snatch lacks in drugs and humor, it makes up for in quick cuts, one-liners and violence. Snatch takes the notorious parts of Pulp Fiction, Fight Club, and Oceans Eleven, puts them in a box, and ties it with a pigskin bow."Anything to declare?"
"Yeah. Don't go to England."
